story:
Shower Drain Heat Recovery

We believe, in the world today, great things can be accomplished by ordinary people, applying known technology to everyday problems, to make life better for everyone. 

We think these things can be accomplished by recognizing root causes of losses, waste, inefficiency, and applying well tested and practical solutions to those problems. 

Our Shower Drain Water Heat Recovery device, captures the wasted heat from the shower drain, preheats the incoming cold water to the shower and to the cold water inlet on your hot water heater, and greatly reduces the cost of heating water in your home. Heating hot water is the #2 largest expense in home energy. 

We accomplish this with a simple device, using code accepted standard building materials, and known technology in heat exchange, fit into a code required area of home plumbing. 

What is it we are Building?

The image above (from the US Department of energy website, demonstrates only the idea. . )

What we have designed and prototyped is a cost effective, code required, heat exchanger, that, captures the heat energy that normally goes down your shower drain, and uses it to preheat the cold incoming water to your shower, and hot water heater. This eliminates 'cold showers' from hot water heaters running out of hot water, and reduces your monthly energy bills. We use standard building materials, known technology, and standard plumbing practices to build the product. 

How is this different than what is on the market today?

We use standard building materials

  • Lasts the same time as other engineered materials in your house.
  • Uses standard existing building practices to install
  • Uses standard building codes

We price our product to have a short pay back period

  • It is NOT economic if it costs you more then you spend now. Our device, costs less then your are spending now, as the savings pay back your purchase in a short period.

Our product was designed to "fit" in homes constructed today, and to retrofit into existing home without major modifications.

  • Existing products are not made with standard building products
  • Existing products are not as efficient because of installation requirements and design
  • Our design does not require additional machinery to move waste water, our product has no moving parts, no electronic controls, no displays, no control equipment.

What We Need & What You Get

The funding we are looking for pays for the required legal aspects of building the business behind producing, marketing, and selling IT.

  • The donations go to paying to make this dream a reality
  • We will use the funds for the following -
  1. Trademarking the product name.
  2. Provisional patent - to protect the idea through the final design and engineering approval process.
  3. We already have a working prototype! Some of the funds will pay to take that prototype through finished Research and Development, Engineering, Testing and Certifications.
  4. Legal fees to incorporate the business.
  5. Negotiations with a contract manufacturer to produce and distribute the finished design.
  6. Marketing the finished product to our primary target market, new home construction companies.

----

What you get from us?

Aside from our immense and eternal gratitude, we want to make your life a little better.  

Once the product is on the market, we want to remember the people who make it possible, and provide a tangible benefit.  

For every dollar you contribute, you'll get two dollars off the market price once we reach general distribution.  

This will not be an immediate benefit, since there is much work to be done before getting to that point.

How do you operate this new piece of equipment? What do you as a shower user have to do to make it work?

This should be a familiar process to most people.

  1. Prepare the individual taking the shower for the shower (rituals vary between individuals)
  2. Open shower access, curtain, door, etc.
  3. Access the controls for the shower, actuate the controls as usual. (This step is critical, as water must be flowing for our unit to work.)
  4. Monitor the temperature of the shower water before entering showering space. The major difference you will notice is, you will tend to have to increase the cold water use, and reduce your hot water use to maintain the same level of hot water. 
  5. Lather, rinse, repeat. This step varies with each individual, as the routine varies. 
  6. At the conclusion of the shower, turn off the water, close the shower access door/opening, resume normal daily routines. 
The basic idea here is, not much changes with our product. There is no maintenance, no adjustments, no controls, no monitoring stations, not even a smartphone application necessary. Very retro. This product, by design, unlike most products, is not in your face, in your way, or even in your view. The only real changes are.  . 

  1. Your water heating bill will be lower, every month (assuming you do not change shower rituals, take 12 hour showers, etc.
  2. You will not run out of hot water in your shower, even if you are the last person to shower. 

The Impact

  • In the United States and Canada, a majority of people depend on showers daily. There are few options that allow you to take a shower, and save any money doing it. We all need it, yet it is an expense we all have to endure. 
  • We built our first, second, and third prototypes in our small shop. We built them for one reason, to try to save money in our own home, to help pay our own bills. On the fourth try, we got it right, and used that prototype for over a year to verify to ourselves that it was safe, and effective. 
  • Our Goal is to see this product replace a current code required plumbing item, in new home construction - as a Standard Building Material!
  • Reduce your Carbon Footprint, without changing your actions! Energy Efficiency. " Energy efficiency is one of the easiest and most cost effective ways to combat climate change, clean the air we breathe, improve the competitiveness of our businesses and reduce energy costs for consumers" - http://energy.gov/science-innovation/energy-efficiency
  • The cost of living for the majority of people living in homes in the US and Canada is reduced, with no negative impact on Quality of life!


"Image courtesy of Salvatore Vuono/ FreeDigitalPhotos.net"

Our Story - How did we get here?

Over 10 years ago, Richard Smith (the inventor of this simple idea) was living in a small average starter home, working, trying to make ends meet. He was the third person to get a morning shower, and every morning he experienced a common problem with home showers. . . it ran out of hot water shortly after getting in.

"I remember standing in the shower, knowing it was going to go cold, and thinking, I wonder just how much heat from the shower is going down the drain, and how much is actually being used. . " Richard said.

". . it was a real change, as soon as the shower starts heating up, you turn the shower control further and further towards the cold side, as you are using less and less hot water from the water heater. . "

"Monthly electric bills from that one shower conversion dropped our bill about 10% a month, and as a test, I ran the shower to find out how much longer it would run before going cold. . . it ran for 8 hours that day, before I finally gave up and stopped the test!! "


What is Drain Water Heat Recovery?

  • Google Search Results for Drain Water Heat Recovery
  • Water Heat Recycling


The American Dream, you, us, and how this makes the world a better place for all of us.


The idea of the American Dream is rooted in the United States Declaration of Independence which proclaims that "all men are created equal" and that they are "endowed by their Creator with certain inalienable Rights" including "Life, Liberty and the pursuit of Happiness."[2] - from Here.

Too often, today, in our society, we are all affected by the changes in business, corporate drive for profits, and the cost to each of us as a result. Low or stagnant wages, high unemployment, increasing costs of living, are all pushing most of us into less and less comfortable living situations.

We strongly believe in a different ideal. We believe that profits for the sake of profits is unsustainable. It is our deepest desire to produce not just this product, but a long list of similar products, designed using the same philosophy that lead us to creating this first product. We choose to participate with only those individuals and companies who adhere to these same beliefs. We insist on a high living wage that allows the people who build, design, produce and distribute our product, to not just exist, but to prosper. It is one of our core beliefs that those who add to the value of our product, receive a growing wealth from adding value.

We also support protection and development of individual intellectual property rights among those who are part of our business. It is all too common that the corporation a person works for, requires individuals to release their intellectual rights as a condition of employment. Not only do we not support this, but on the contrary, we support the idea of using corporate profits to protect, and develop future ideas, inventions, designs, and developments, to increase the pursuit of happiness of those very individuals in our organization who originate those creative ideas.

Your support of this campaign, directly contributes to changing the very way that we do business in our society, by promoting the individual in our corporation, promoting the ideals of liberty and the chance to prosper as a corporation of people.


Thank you

FAQ - Frequently Asked Questions

  1. Can I buy your product today?

    1. We currently have the only prototype in the world for this product. The goal of this campaign is to raise the funds necessary to bring this to a finished product, to have them manufactures (in the US, using American labor).

    2. Contributing to this campaign gives you two advantages

      1. You are on a list of Beta testers and will be first contacted when our Beta Testing program starts.

      2. For each dollar you contribute, you get credit for $2 towards the price of our finished units.

  2. Is this some new technology that is going to take years to “discover”?

    1. No, this is existing technology, used in industry and retail markets for years.

    2. Our plan is to have this a finished manufactured device in a number of months, not years.

  3. Why has this been overlooked by energy efficiency experts?

    1. Typical engineering today views any energy used for its designed purpose unwasted once it is used for that purpose, regardless of what happens after that original purpose.

    2. Traditional and typical engineering is largely based on an old outdated model that says, “energy is cheap”, so if you are running out of hot water before the showers are done, buy a bigger hot water heater.

  4. The government is working on energy efficiency aren’t they?

    1. Do you remember what the last product that was created through a government sponsored program to save you energy was?

    2. The government, and many of the companies who receive government funding are very effective at using government funds to produce reports that make it very clear that more funding needs to go into developing energy efficiency. . . or reports. . .

  5. Is this product safe?

    1. Yes. We are very conscience of safety in our homes, and with our product, in your home as well. We will not release the product until it is thoroughly tested and is accepted by current building standards and codes.

  6. I work for a company who builds new homes. We are interested in your product as a way to meet every more stringent building energy efficiency requirements. Can we contact you about getting these products?

    1. Yes, there are many methods of contacting us, we would love to hear from you.

A special thanks to ddpavumba and FreeDigitalPhotos.net for our logo! Cheers!

Even if you can't contribute cash, help us out by spreading the word!! This is a great idea, and the more people who know, the more can help. Facebook us, Twitter us, and tell your friends and family!!

We currently have the only prototype in the world for this product. The goal of this campaign is to raise the funds necessary to bring this to a finished product, to have them manufactures (in the US, using American labor). 
Contributing to this campaign gives you two advantages

You are on a list of Beta testers and will be first contacted when our Beta Testing program starts.
For each dollar you contribute, you get credit for $2 towards the price of our finished units. 


Is this some new technology that is going to take years to “discover”?

No, this is existing technology, used in industry and retail markets for years. 
Our plan is to have this a finished manufactured device in a number of months, not years.

Why has this been overlooked by energy efficiency experts?

Typical engineering today views any energy used for its designed purpose unwasted once it is used for that purpose, regardless of what happens after that original purpose. 
Traditional and typical engineering is largely based on an old outdated model that says, “energy is cheap”, so if you are running out of hot water before the showers are done, buy a bigger hot water heater. 

The government is working on energy efficiency aren’t they?

Do you remember what the last product that was created through a government sponsored program to save you energy was?
The government, and many of the companies who receive government funding are very effective at using government funds to produce reports that make it very clear that more funding needs to go into developing energy efficiency. . . or reports. . . 

Is this product safe?
Yes. We are very conscience of safety in our homes, and with our product, in your home as well. We will not release the product until it is thoroughly tested and is accepted by current building standards and codes. 
I work for a company who builds new homes. We are interested in your product as a way to meet every more stringent building energy efficiency requirements. Can we contact you about getting these products?
Yes, there are many methods of contacting us, we would love to hear from you.
A special thanks to ddpavumba and FreeDigitalPhotos.net for our logo! Cheers!Even if you can't contribute cash, help us out by spreading the word!! This is a great idea, and the more people who know, the more can help. Facebook us, Twitter us, and tell your friends and family!!

story:
SPROG: A Training for Changemakers

For more than 10 years, the Sierra Student Coalition’s Summer Training Program (SPROG) has been empowering youth leaders with the tools they need to start movements, run campaigns andcreate the world they want to live in:

  • We are the Northwest Regional SPROG team.
  • For one week this summer, youth will come together from across the Pacific Northwest to learn, share, grow, and connect to become future leaders and organizers. 
  • Participants learn how to:
    • work with the media, facilitate meetings, recruit members to their cause, meet with decision makers, promote anti-oppression, and much more through fun interactive trainings. They are able to apply all of these new skills in a simulation training at the end of the week.
  • "At SPROG, I formed a community with passionate people, where I felt I could return to my other communities to create the change I wanted to see in the world, knowing that I had the support of fellow SPROG parcipants and the skills to make an impact." -Terra Smith, NW SPROG 2010

Your contribution will go towards providing travel and tuition scholarships so that all youth who are interested can attend SPROG, no matter their financial circumstances. With your donation you will be investing in the future leaders, decision-makers, organizers, and change-makers of tomorrow.

Funding Details

  • We are raising $3,000 ($1,000 online and $2,000 through events and other means) to provide scholarships to participants to cover their tuition costs. The tuition covers lodging, food, and training materials, which is $350 per person.
  • All training is done completely by volunteers, the majority of which are previous SPROG participants.
  • We think that everyone should have an equal opportunity to come to SPROG and with your contribution we can ensure that the next visionary leader will not be turned away due to lack of funds.

The Impact

  • SPROG provides an opportunity for youth to develop their leadership skills and gives them the tools to create positive change. These youth will become future leaders.
  • Past SPROG participants, such as Nathan Jones, founder of the Cascade Climate Network and the Northwest Institute for Community Enrichment, have gone on to become important, influential and inspiring leaders.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Spread the word and make some noise about our campaign! Let friends and family know about this opportunity to help youth reach their full potential as leaders! 
  • You can use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Encourage youth you know to attend a SPROG! https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1h2pdmdXuO1XylP_BcruROisQ1SnwtIcwizkkIl1ZtcU/viewform

story:
Short Summary

"And the time came when the risk to remain tight in a bud was more painful than the risk it took to blossom." -Anais Nin 

Well, friends, that time has arrived!  I'm about to embark on what I find to be both incredibly exciting and scary at the same time - a volunteer adventure around the world!  I will visit a number of different places (spanning five continents) and participate in carefully-researched volunteer projects in each location.  My journey will likely include community, educational, and conservation efforts in England, Scotland, Canada, Australia, Costa Rica, Ecuador, Kenya, and Tanzania.  I will be working with people from all over the world and living in various kinds of environments trying to learn as much as I can and sprinkle lots of goodness along the way!

This is important to me both as a tribute to my grandparents, who have all passed on at this point and who were each bold in their respective ways, and because I believe so strongly in our ability to use our passions, talents, and resources to help make the world a better place, even if the idea seems cliche or idealistic.  

This adventure has been a dream of mine for quite a while, and it's now time to chase it.  Your donations will help make this possible by helping me get from place to place, replant native vegetation, gather data on wildlife habitats and behavior, rehabilitate injured animals, and work with both children and adults to learn more English and math skills and gain greater confidence in their own abilities.  

What's Needed & What You Get

I have spent a long time researching this journey by reading through books, brochures, websites, and online discussions and reviews to try to make the best decisions I can and be as sure as possible that I've chosen organizations that are trustworthy and operate with integrity - running legitimate programs that work closely with the local population to help ensure local needs are being met and volunteer impact is both warranted and desired.  

I am funding most of this trip by myself, but I am hoping to raise $2250 with this campaign to help my participation in these projects.  There are a lot of expenses associated with a trip of this magnitude, and every little bit will help me achieve my goal.  Visas, tickets, insurance, airport fees and taxes, meals, accommodations, transportation, and program fees must all be budgeted and covered.  

This is a big endeavor.  I've never done anything like this before, and your help - no matter the amount - will be greatly appreciated!  You will be an integral part of this journey and will provide both tangible and intangible impacts around the world!  You can join with other people who are also contributing to this adventure and help me get from place to place and reach more locations.

You can share this journey with me in another way, too!  I plan to start a blog before leaving and maintain it throughout my trip, whenever possible, so that I can keep my family and friends updated on my volunteer projects along the way and you can read about the impact your donations are making.

Since all funds will help, even if I do not reach my goal, I will still be able to put your donations to good use.  And... In the best-case scenario of exceeding my goal :), extra funds could be used to participate in more projects or stay with currently-planned projects for longer periods of time.

The Impact

It is, honestly, hard to say what the impact of such an undertaking will be.  I suspect, and hope, it will be multi-faceted, but perhaps difficult to define empirically.  On some of the more research-oriented projects, data gathered while I'm there may help inform future habitat goals and policies, educational materials, the general scientific knowledge base, and at least in one case, the organization publishes the results of the study.  My understanding is that other impacts include reforestation of native flora species which will, in turn, provide greater habitat for native fauna, care for injured and orphaned animals as they prepare to return to a wilder, more natural habitat, and assistance for people wanting to learn new communication skills.  

My hope, of course, is that these impacts extend even further into the future... But I don't want to put too many expectations on specific outcomes, especially as I will likely never know about those impacts.  There are still so many unknowns, and some things simply cannot be measured.  What is the impact, for instance, of an impromptu soccer game after class or spending time with people and leaning more about them and their ideas? 

I sincerely hope to make a positive difference throughout my trip, and I am certain that I, too, will change as a result of this journey - perhaps more so than the places and people I visit, so it's a big leap I'm about to take!

Other Ways You Can Help

You can help in so many ways: offering support, communication, and well-wishes are most definitely appreciated!  Also...

Give early and give often! :)

And feel free to spread the word.  If you know of other good people who might be legitimately interested in supporting this project, please let them know.  The more people who know, the better chance we'll have of making this happen!

Give early and give often! :)
And feel free to spread the word.  If you know of other good people who might be legitimately interested in supporting this project, please let them know.  The more people who know, the better chance we'll have of making this happen!

story:
RYAN'S HOPE

 

Ryan is a 20 year old free-spirited, kind loving soul, whos one mission in life is to spread love and help those who need it. His passion is helping the environment, donating his time to multiple Organizations, attending College and working.

 He recently rode his Touring Bicycle, a Novara Express, 400 miles from San Francisco to Los Angeles just for the adventure of it.

Unfortunately, his Bike was recently taken from his home in the Venice Beach area. It was his sole transportation for all that he does.

In order to turn a negative into a positive, some friends came together and brainstormed and came up with the idea for the Fundraiser. 

 A great cause Ryan likes to help out with is Feed the Children Organization. A portion of the money from the Fundraiser will benefit the local chapter of this organization. The other portion of the proceeds will go toward a new Bicycle for Ryan.

Prizes will be handed out at a Fundraising Event/Party on November 3rd 2012 . The location of the fundraising event will be given to those who give a $10 donation,

Thank you for your time.

story:
Our beds are unique, distinctive and unlike any others currently offered.  We offer three styles of beds, in many sizes, as well as pet car seats, crate mats and throws. (Click any product pic for more info)

                                                A 100% Woman Owned Company 

THE INDIEGOGO FUNDS

The pledges from the Project will be used for marketing to grow Pampered Pets, nationally and internationally, development of new product styles, inventory of materials (to reduce cost), warehouse space, and eventually to hire some staff.

Our Signature style is Upholstery grade fabric with a luxurious soft fur cushion filled with shredded memory foam. This is the oval bed, Latte, for any pledge between $150 & $265. Pledges of $500 or more gets you any of our extensive fabrics.

 

 

Here is the round bed in Cheetah soft fur filled with shredded memory foam for any pledge between $100 & $250. Pledges of $500 or more gets you any of our extensive fabrics.

 

                                                                    18”- 30”- 36”
                             Cushion is filled with shredded memory foam. Zippered & Washable.
                                                      Chloe The Spokesdog not included.                                                  

Some of our custom-made beds.

Click above for more info.

We do not use polyfill in our cushions; only shredded memory foam and an upgrade to down & feathers. Our beds feature luxurious ultra suede and microfiber covers and soft fur cushions. This upholstery grade fabric is built to last and look great doing it.

Sizing: Measure your dog from the tip of his nose to the base of his/her tail then add 5".  You may also want to measure him/her in their sleep position.

Ex Small (up to 5 lbs.)     
13”w x 10”d x 5”h with a 1” cushion 
Small (up to 10 lbs.) 
20”w x 15.5”d x 6”h with a 1.5” cushion
Medium (up to 25 lbs.) 
26”w x 20”d x 7”h with a 2” cushion
Large (up to 35 lbs.) 
36”w x 24”d x 7”h with a 2” cushion

A portion of every sale is donated to one of our selected pet charities. We also are very active in fund raising for several charities, including adoption & rescue centers.

Custom-made Pet Car Seats - Safe Pet Travel! (Click for more info)

 

Click above to read the article

Our Pet Car Seat provides a great ride for the pampered pet.  The design of Cthe seat elevates pets to provide a clear view of the road.  Sturdy foam frame with several fabric options so that you can match or accent the interior of your vehicle.

The tether (included) can be attached to your pets harness for security.  Please do not attach a tether to a pet’s collar as serious injury could occur.  Installs securely in less than one minute utilizing your vehicles’ seat belt system.  It features a padded memory foam seat for comfort and luxury.  It also makes a comfortable bed when traveling. 3 sizes.
ABC NEWS - Dogs Causing Accidents - Dog Crtash Dummies

Custom-made beds in your favorite Team colors. Any Team, any sport, pro or college. Make a $500 Pledge. (Click for more info)

 

 
 
 
Round & Rectangle Beds - (Click for more info)
 
 
 
 

 

Pet Strollers & Bike Trailer/Jogger/Stroller (Imported) - (Click for more info)

 

Throws & Mats (Crate) - (Click for more info)

 

 

Our Network of Affiliates
Currently our products are in 4 stores; 2 in downtown Chicago, 1 in Barrington IL and 1 in Laguna Beach CA. These are upscale stores, Boutiques  Groomers, in affluent areas.

We just returned from the SuperZoo Pet Expo (12,000 Pet Retailers in attendance) where our products were very well received. We signed up 15 to 20 new Resellers!

We are preparing a direct mail and email campaign to be sent this month to additional stores. We also sell on our website, PamperedPets.biz.

We also will be exhibiting at these shows:

Sept 2012 - SuperZoo in Las Vegas. 12,000 pet retailers
Jan  2013 - Atlanta Accessory Show. Bedding & Boutique store retailers
July 2013 - Atlanta Accessory Show. Bedding & Boutique store retailers
July 2013 - SuperZoo in Las Vegas. 12,000 pet retailers

We Thank You for your support!

Testimonials & Photos

story:
Help us build a robust ridesharing service for Maritimers. Donate to improve community-based transportation.


Born out of the Acadian Bus Service Stoppage

We launched a ridesharing prototype when Acadian Bus Lines went on strike this past Christmas called maritimerideshare.com. The bus strike affected almost all route services. There were countless stories of people wanting to get home for the holidays who were forced to fly or find a family member to come pick them up. We thought, there must be a better way for Maritimers to get around. So, for a week, a team of us locked ourselves in a room and put together the maritimerideshare.com prototype.

In June, VIA Rail announced a reduction in service to the Maritimes AND just this week, Acadian Bus Lines announced that they are closing down their service this coming November. Consequently, the Maritimes will be left without any bus service. For the past 6 months we've seen a tremendous amount of success with ridesharing in the Maritimes but we want to improve upon our system to see more people connecting through ridesharing. Primarily this means addressing safety concerns by introducing user reviews, driver validation, etc.  

 

We Want to IMPROVE RIDESHARING in the Maritimes

Our goal is to raise $18,500 so we can build a website that provides all the features that we feel are needed to make maritimerideshare.com a viable replacement for those previously using bus and train. To this end, money raised will be used to develop:

  • Better security - a driver rating system, profile identification checks, and more detailed information about users  
  • Better coverage - Offer the service in ALL Maritime regions
  • Improved Searchability - search by date and to and/or from city
  • Better trip planning - find out who needs a ride in cities along your way 
  • Recieve payments online before you leave
  • Help improve the design and user interface of the site
  • Launch a marketing campaign - more rides posted, means more options for those seeking rideshares. We're going to run a small postering and email campaign around maritime universities and colledges

Ridesharing Works

In France last year, a ridesharing website generated over 1,000,000 rides during the summer months alone. That's a lot of transportation needs fulfilled, money saved and CO2 saved. We're Maritimers! We're known for being community minded. Let's get ridesharing going in the Maritimes! We hope you can help us in this effort.

 

What People Are Saying

“I only found out about your website two weeks ago from an add on Kijiji. I have￼￼￼ been able to offer rides through this program every weekend since! I've been ￼getting 2-3 request per add and sent 1-2 offers. I drive to Moncton every ￼weekend, this now pays for my gas and my guests are more than willing to pay ￼what I ask! Great Job!”

- Morgan LeBlanc

“Rideshare is awesome! I'm happy I found it. I'm always looking for rides to and ￼￼￼from PEI so it can be a big help. I am always checking on the website for posts!￼ Thanks for creating it! It's very helpful!”

- Gillian Arsenault

“I think the site is an awesome idea, I’m sure it will get a critical mass.”

- Shannon Courtney 

Other Ways You Can Help

Whether you are able to make a contribution or not, we wish to gain your support in other ways. We are very passionate about this project, and hope that you share even a fraction of our enthusiasm.

If you aren't able to give a financial donation, then here are some other super great ways for you to help us out:

 - Volunteer (contact us, especially if you are a university student)
 - Sign up to our Rideshare Newsletter
 - Share this indiegogo campaign
 - Point your friends to maritimerideshare.com
 - Like us on Facebook
      - Halifax facebook Page
      - PEI facebook page
      - Moncton facebook page
      - Fredericton facebook page

 

Questions? Comments?

We'd love to hear from you. Drop us a line!

• Scott Gallant scott@maritimerideshare.com

• Nathalie Arsenault nathalie@maritimerideshare.com

In June, VIA Rail announced a reduction in service to the Maritimes AND just this week, Acadian Bus Lines announced that they are closing down their service this coming November. Consequently, the Maritimes will be left without any bus service. For the past 6 months we've seen a tremendous amount of success with ridesharing in the Maritimes but we want to improve upon our system to see more people connecting through ridesharing. Primarily this means addressing safety concerns by introducing user reviews, driver validation, etc.  
 


We Want to IMPROVE RIDESHARING in the Maritimes
Our goal is to raise $18,500 so we can build a website that provides all the features that we feel are needed to make maritimerideshare.com a viable replacement for those previously using bus and train. To this end, money raised will be used to develop:


Better security - a driver rating system, profile identification checks, and more detailed information about users  

Better coverage - Offer the service in ALL Maritime regions

Improved Searchability - search by date and to and/or from city

Better trip planning - find out who needs a ride in cities along your way 
Recieve payments online before you leave
Help improve the design and user interface of the site

Launch a marketing campaign - more rides posted, means more options for those seeking rideshares. We're going to run a small postering and email campaign around maritime universities and colledges



Ridesharing Works
In France last year, a ridesharing website generated over 1,000,000 rides during the summer months alone. That's a lot of transportation needs fulfilled, money saved and CO2 saved. We're Maritimers! We're known for being community minded. Let's get ridesharing going in the Maritimes! We hope you can help us in this effort.
 


What People Are Saying
“I only found out about your website two weeks ago from an add on Kijiji. I have￼￼￼ been able to offer rides through this program every weekend since! I've been ￼getting 2-3 request per add and sent 1-2 offers. I drive to Moncton every ￼weekend, this now pays for my gas and my guests are more than willing to pay ￼what I ask! Great Job!”
- Morgan LeBlanc
“Rideshare is awesome! I'm happy I found it. I'm always looking for rides to and ￼￼￼from PEI so it can be a big help. I am always checking on the website for posts!￼ Thanks for creating it! It's very helpful!”
- Gillian Arsenault
“I think the site is an awesome idea, I’m sure it will get a critical mass.”
- Shannon Courtney 
Other Ways You Can Help
Whether you are able to make a contribution or not, we wish to gain your support in other ways. We are very passionate about this project, and hope that you share even a fraction of our enthusiasm.
If you aren't able to give a financial donation, then here are some other super great ways for you to help us out: - Volunteer (contact us, especially if you are a university student) - Sign up to our Rideshare Newsletter - Share this indiegogo campaign - Point your friends to maritimerideshare.com - Like us on Facebook      - Halifax facebook Page      - PEI facebook page      - Moncton facebook page      - Fredericton facebook page
 
Questions? Comments?
We'd love to hear from you. Drop us a line!
• Scott Gallant scott@maritimerideshare.com
• Nathalie Arsenault nathalie@maritimerideshare.com

story:
About the Solar Field in the Galápagos

Yosef Abramowitz, A.K.A. 'Captain Sunshine', who has been recognized by CNN as one of six leading green pioneers on the planet and the Co-founder of Energiya Global, needs your help to build a 300KW solar power field on San Cristóbal Island in the Galápagos.
 
                                                                  San Cristóbal Island
 
Yosef is accustomed to building large solar fields with big investors, but the solar field in the Galápagos is too small a project for these investors, they see it as small potatoes. Yosef and Energiya Global hope that they will break even from the field only in 15 years, so they have committed to donating all the profits back into the Galápagos community.Charles Darwin Research Station
 
Worried about the impact a solar field will have on the environment there? So is Captain Sunshine, that is why we are building the field on an old garbage dump.
                       Existing garbage dump soon to be replaced with our solar field

Where We Are Today

We have completed almost all of the pre-development stages including:

  • 1.5 hectares of land in San Cristobal secured via a 15 years land lease with the municipality.
  • A Certificate of Intersection was obtained for the solar project.
  • The Galapagos National Park (PNG) approved the Environmental Impact Assessment.
  • Executed a pre-feasibility study which estimated the potential PV solar energy to be fed into the Island grid.
                                         Yosef meeting with the Mayor of San Cristóbal

What We Need

With your help, we need to raise $250,000 in order to build the field and start supplying clean energy to the Galápagos. 

Specifically, the money will be spent on the following:

  • Final pre-development costs including the grid connection design and the final electricity study.
  • Down payment to the EPC (Engineering, Procurement and Construction) company that will build the project. The down payment will ensure the EPC company can start moving forward with the shipping of the necessary equipment to the Galapagos in time to meet the Ecuadorian regulator's deadline for the project to be built and interconnected.

Meanwhile, we need to put a $25,000 deposit down to allow us to continue building the field. Therefore, we have changed the goal of this campaign from $250,000 to $25,000 in order to help us meet this imminent deadline.

What You Get

We need your help, so we want you to feel part of the campaign and every contribution, big or small, is important to us. Everyone who contributes $36 or more will receive a thank you postcard signed by Captain Sunshine sent from the Galápagos. We of course have great T-shirts, hats, solar electricity producing backpacks, and other souvenirs that we will be giving away as rewards and we will be updating our rewards frequently, so please check in with us often.

We want our contributors to feel ownership over the solar field and know that it was built because of you. For contributors who give $500 we will inscribe your name into our contributors monument that we will be erecting next to the solar field. For contributors who want to contribute the cost of an entire solar panel - $1000 - we will dedicate the panel to you or anyone you choose with an engraved plaque that will be placed next to the panel.

The Impact

Currently, the Galápagos relies mainly on dirty diesel oil for electricity, which needs to be shipped across the ocean in heavy polluting boats. Every week the solar field will replace the burning of 20 barrels of oil (842 US Gallons), that's 930 barrels of oil (147,000 Liters or 39,000 US Gallons) a year not being shipped to the Galápagos and burned there.

The reliance on diesel oil poses an enormous threat to the environment and the species that live on the Galápagos. In 2001, the oil tanker 'Jessica', on its way to an oil port transfer station in the Galápagos, scraped against the seabed causing the boat to fill with water and capsize, spilling the oil contents of the boat into the sea: a total of 175,000 US gallons (660,000 L) of diesel and fuel were spilled. It was one of the worst environmental disasters in the archipelago's history.

Every dollar you contribute to this campaign will not just help build the solar field in the Galápagos, it will also send a message about the importance and feasibility of solar energy. After the successful creation of the solar field in San Cristóbal, we will prove once again the benefits of replacing fossil fuels with renewable and clean energy, shining the way forward for more solar projects throughout the world.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please remember to tell your friends and family about this campaign so they can be a part of it too. We need all the help we can get. Captain Sunshine needs you!

About Energiya Global

Mission

Energiya Global develops affordable solar projects worldwide, with the goal of providing clean electricity for 50 million people by 2020.

Vision

Our vision is for a world in which the developing nations will be powered predominantly by clean, safe, affordable, renewable energy. Clean energy will not be a luxury that only wealthy nations can afford, but will be the energy of choice for lifting people in developing countries out of poverty. Energya Global mobilizes the ingenuity and the values of Israel and the Jewish People to reduce the world's dependence on fossil fuels and empower people globally.

What We Do

Energiya Global develops solar PV projects from planning through to implementation.

Energiya Global's core activities include identifying promising markets, securing land, carrying out necessary studies and tests, obtaining permits, negotiating Power Purchase Agreements with governments or utilities and bringing debt and equity finance. 

Energiya Global in Rwanda

Energiya Global is developing the first utility-scale solar PV project in Rwanda. Our local partner is the Agahozo-Shalom Youth Village for orphans of the Rwandan genocide.

Energiya Global in Romania

Energiya Global is developing two projects in the Ialomita region of Romania – one of 8 MW and another of 100 MW. Groundbreaking on the 8 MW project took place in May 2012

About Captain Sunshine

Named by CNN as one of the top six Green Pioneers worldwide, Yosef Abramowitz serves as President of the Arava Power Company, Israel's leading solar developer. Arava Power built the first grid-connected solar field in Israel and recently closed on $204 million for the next eight solar fields in Israel, with a further $2 billion worth of projects in the pipeline. An entrepreneur, environmentalist and human rights activist, Yosef has established Energiya Global to bring solar power on a commercial basis to developing nations. Yosef was named to the Jerusalem Post's list of 50 most influential Jews worldwide in 2011 and 2012 and has been co-nominated 3 times for the Nobel Peace Prize. Yosef was also awarded "Person of the Year" by the 2012 Israel Energy and Business Convention.

story:
A MEGASTAR THANK YOU FOR ALL THE SUPPORT THAT HAS BEEN SHOWN TO THE CAMPAIGN SO FAR. YOU ARE AMAZING. KEEP IT COMING!

Pincha aqui para una traducción en español

WHEN DID YOU LAST SEE THE STARS AGAINST A DARK SKY?

All species are intricately linked to dark night skies. 

The ever increasing light pollution that is spreading across the world means WE loose the ability to see the stars, a resource that aided our ancestors to survive. And we interfere with nocturnal biodiversity, because many plants and animals, including the human species, rely on the rhythm of the dark skies and moon for their development. HELP us protect the dark night sky!

Have you ever seen the Milky Way? Did you know that the Sun is a star too? Do you realise the importance of a dark night sky for all species on our planet? There is so much to learn about the universe, but ultimately the first thing we must do is look up and be amazed at the pure beauty of a starry-lit sky.

STARS BY NIGHT has been created to inspire interest in our dark night skies again. By making the dark night sky more accessible, allows the education of the intricate and sometimes unbelievable cosmos that we are all part of. Through stargazing, astronomy courses and astrophotography we can get everyone interested in protecting this environment.

HELP US to protect the dark night sky. DONATE NOW.

What we need and what you get

This campaign is raising funds on behalf of Stars by Night. We are an ecotourism business set to revolutionize tourism in Fuerteventura. We need YOUR HELP with the essential start up costs to get this off the ground. 

Unfortunately MONEY TALKS. We need to buy a telescope, some binoculars, and cover administration costs involved in setting up a new business in Spain. The project has been awarded a certification by the Canarian Government to receive funding support, but the money has run out! Hence why I am really relying on you guys to help us get started.
 
YOU GET good karma through protecting the dark sky for yourself and everyone else, the chance to come and learn about the stars, support our kids to strive for more and be part of a project that is helping to protect our natural heritage. And there is more! Check out the great perks – an exclusive night of star observation with our pheneomnal "El Senor de las Estrellas", photos from Jose Luis Valdivia, your support eternally credited on our website for the world to see and my never ending gratitude!
 
EVERY PENNY YOU GIVE COUNTS and we are eternally in your debt for it! 
 
If we don't make the full amount we will survive through rental of certain equipement, however, your donations will give us the chance to show a professional front from the very beginning. 
 
I have put together a very strong team of professionals. I can't begin to list the numerous credentials of our astronomer and photographer. Click on their names to gage an understanding of their immense abilities!

Other Ways You Can Help

TURN THE LIGHTS OFF and share the campaign on all socail network sites. 
 
Let's all take a little time out and look up at our stars by night!
 

Keep up to date with project progress through our website, blog, Twitter and Facebook. Find a dark spot and look up. Switch off from your daily routine and immerse yourself in the beauty and the enormity of the universe above!

story:
What is Firefly?

Firefly is a octocopter designed to help firefighters get an accurate map of wildfires by automatically surveying a fire's border. Firefly uses a heat sensitive camera and advanced guidance system to navigate around a fire and transmit the GPS coordinates to firefighters on the ground. 

Firefly can also drop wireless beacons along the boundary of a fire at specific GPS coordinates. These beacons then radio back temperature and air quality data, which can be placed on a map using Firefly's GPS coordinates. These sensors help firefighters to determine the direction and speed a fire is moving, without the need for constant aerial sureillance.

HeatBeacons

One of the unique innovations provided by Firefly is it's disposable wildfire sensors, called HeatBeacons. These sensors are designed to be inexpensive and disposable, which makes them ideal for deployment around an active wildfire. Ideally, Firefly will drop these sensors around the edge of an active wildfire at preset GPS coordinates.

The sensors measure three things: temperature, carbon monoxide, and smoke (air particulates). These three values are encoded into a data packet, along with the sensor's unique ID, and transmitted back to ground control or nearby Firefly drones. Combined with GPS data, these sensors will allow firefighters to track a fire's movement in real-time.

Due to the possibility of these sensors being destroyed by fire or abandoned in wooded areas, we've designed these sensors to be water-resistant, lead-free, and use a minimal amount of petroleum-based materials.


Common Operating Picture

Another key feature of Firefly is the ground control software. Our integrated mission planner and live status map provides firefighters with a "common operating picture", supplying information needed to make critical, time-sensitive decisions. Firefly can also relay the common operating picture to firefighters in the field via a mobile app.

Our software is capable of controlling a fleet of up to 5 drones simultaneously. Firefly can be set to automatically patrol the border of a fire, or to standby for distress signals from deployed beacons. This allows ground controllers to more effectively monitor complex fires, which may have multiple fronts and be rapidly changing direction.

Development Progress

Over the course of nine (9) months, we've developed and tested nearly every component of the Firefly system. We started by designing the wireless HeatBeacon sensors and the mechanism used to drop them in the field. We tested these systems on a DJI drone to ensure they worked as planned.

After HeatBeacon was completed, we began developing our own drone from the ground up. We designed an airframe which could accommodate the size and weight of six (6) HeatBeacons and a FLIR camera. We then developed our own custom avionics system and firmware. After the drone was completed, we moved on to the desktop software which is used to control Firefly and visualize live wildfire data.

The only remaining component is the drone's guidance system. The guidance software works by interpreting images captured by the FLIR camera, relaying the data to ground control, and commanding the drone where to go next. This has proven to be the most difficult component to develop, and is the primary reason we need your help to make Firefly a reality!

Whats Next?

Patrick and Jeremy, the inventors of Firefly, have funded the project entirely on their own up to this point, but we need your help to cross the finish line! If we can raise $180,000, we can complete the FLIR guidance system, build several production Firefly units, and conduct a "full-scale" test in cooperation with state governments.

If you help us reach our goal of $180,000, we will donate Firefly units to both California and Colorado. This will also allow us to collect feedback on Firefly's performance, helping us to work out any bugs and add missing features.

A Personal Note

We started by designing the wireless HeatBeacon sensors and the mechanism used to drop them in the field. This will also allow us to collect feedback on Firefly's performance, helping us to work out any bugs and add missing features.A Personal Note  
Our hometown, Colorado Springs, has seen more than it's fair share of wildfires over the last few years. In 2012, western Colorado Springs was nearly destroyed by the Waldo Canyon Fire. This fire caused nearly $453 million in damage, burned over 18,240 acres of Pike National Forest, and killed an elderly couple in their Mountain Shadows home. A year later, the Black Forest Fire burned 486 homes and killed another two people.These events have left a scar, both physical and emotional, on Colorado Springs. Residents have become much more aware of the danger posed by wildfires, and the local governments have improved their response plans and firefighting equipment. We hope that Firefly can be a new part of that defense, helping to quickly analyze a fire's size and movement, without risking human lives on the ground or in aircraft.

story:
Over the last 5 years since the economy took a nose dive there has been an overwhelming push for people to move off the grid, and to find other ways to live that consume less resources and live in harmony with nature.

As a computer developer / part time newspaper writer I have seen first hand both our dependence on technology and the personal struggles families have gone through over the years just to survive and put food on the table.

My goal with this fundraising is to purchase approximately 5 - 10 acres of land in east TN, KY or NC and go completely off the grid building a cob home, creating a small solar / wind / water farm to produce power.

Through the process myself and my good friend Linda would document our journey with daily / weekly video logs, blog posts and tips on what has worked and what was a complete waste of time!

We will also experiment with micro-farming and subsidence living to try to become fully self sustainable in a matter of years.

Help us fulfill this dream by funding us with whatever you can, and together our journey is only just beginning.

Our website will go live at the conclusion of this funding campaign and our story will truly begin.

What is Cob?

The word cob comes from an old English root meaning a lump or rounded mass. Cob building in its purest form uses nothing but hands and feet to mix sand, straw and other ingredients into a solid mass used to build walls. Cob is relatively easy to learn, and costs far less compared to a standard home and can be created for even less than your average Tiny Home.

Earth homes are cool in summer, warm in winter. Cob's resistance to many elements make it the perfect building medium.

Why the Mountains?

Land in my experience is cheaper where people believe it will be harder to develop, to that end with our budget we have decided that KY, NC or TN would be perfectly suited to our project.

As well as our video blogs I hope to use my passion for photography to take photographs of the nature that inhabits our land and the surrounding area.

About Me

I am a 35 year old British citizen living in the USA for 10 years now. I am a Computer Developer / Website Developer by trade but also run a popular online newspaper with 10,000 monthly readers.

Over the last few years the newspaper has drawn me into photography and I have spent many days hiking in nature enjoying the outdoors.

I guess you could say I want a change of direction and I believe sharing my experiences will not only make me a better person but will I hope in some ways show the rest of America and the world that there is another way to live that does not depend solely on consumerism and buying bigger and better!
story_txt: Over the last 5 years since the economy took a nose dive there has been an overwhelming push for people to move off the grid, and to find other ways to live that consume less resources and live in harmony with nature.As a computer developer / part time newspaper writer I have seen first hand both our dependence on technology and the personal struggles families have gone through over the years just to survive and put food on the table.My goal with this fundraising is to purchase approximately 5 - 10 acres of land in east TN, KY or NC and go completely off the grid building a cob home, creating a small solar / wind / water farm to produce power.Through the process myself and my good friend Linda would document our journey with daily / weekly video logs, blog posts and tips on what has worked and what was a complete waste of time!We will also experiment with micro-farming and subsidence living to try to become fully self sustainable in a matter of years.Help us fulfill this dream by funding us with whatever you can, and together our journey is only just beginning.Our website will go live at the conclusion of this funding campaign and our story will truly begin.What is Cob?The word cob comes from an old English root meaning a lump or rounded mass. Cob building in its purest form uses nothing but hands and feet to mix sand, straw and other ingredients into a solid mass used to build walls. Cob is relatively easy to learn, and costs far less compared to a standard home and can be created for even less than your average Tiny Home.Earth homes are cool in summer, warm in winter. Cob's resistance to many elements make it the perfect building medium.Why the Mountains?Land in my experience is cheaper where people believe it will be harder to develop, to that end with our budget we have decided that KY, NC or TN would be perfectly suited to our project.As well as our video blogs I hope to use my passion for photography to take photographs of the nature that inhabits our land and the surrounding area.About MeI am a 35 year old British citizen living in the USA for 10 years now. I am a Computer Developer / Website Developer by trade but also run a popular online newspaper with 10,000 monthly readers.Over the last few years the newspaper has drawn me into photography and I have spent many days hiking in nature enjoying the outdoors.I guess you could say I want a change of direction and I believe sharing my experiences will not only make me a better person but will I hope in some ways show the rest of America and the world that there is another way to live that does not depend solely on consumerism and buying bigger and better!

story:
Dans l’intention d’approfondir de manière concrète et engagée mes 
connaissance des réalités humaines et sociales d’un pays en développement, je prépare un séjour de coopération internationale au Nicaragua. Je vous invite à contribuer à ce projet en appuyant financièrement mon initiative de solidarité internationale.

Qui? : Neuf stagiaires et un accompagnateur membres de l’organisme de coopération internationale Mer et Monde, en partenariat avec l’association nicaraguayenne Tierra y Vida et le ministère des Relations internationales et de la Francophonie du Québec.

Où?: Dans la communauté de Calishuate, département de Carazo, au Nicaragua. 

Quand?: Deux mois et demi au cours de l’été 2015 au Nicaragua, suite à six fins de semaine de formation intensive réparties sur huit mois au Québec.

Quoi?: Appuyer l’association Tierra y Vida dans un projet visant l’augmentation durable de la production et de la consommation de produits agrobiologiques. 

La mission de cette association est de soutenir les organisations de paysans et les familles vulnérables, en mettant l’emphase sur les jeunes et les femmes, dans l’adoption de pratiques agrobiologiques dans leurs systèmes de production et dans l’amélioration du commerce local de produits sains.

Comment?: Notre rôle de stagiaire consistera à soutenir l’initiative locale en agrobiologie. À cet effet, nous serons appelés à :

• Monter une campagne de sensibilisation et de promotion d’une production agricole saine, autant pour l’environnement que pour l’alimentation.

• Créer du matériel et des outils pédagogiques portant sur l’agriculture écologique.

• Offrir un appui technique sur le terrain.

• Mettre en place une méthode de suivi de la production des fermes agrobiologiques de la région.

Votre participation? : Nous sollicitons votre collaboration dans le développement de ce projet solidaire. Un don aiderait grandement au succès de notre stage. 

Sachez que votre don aura un impact direct sur la réduction de la pauvreté et l’amélioration de la qualité de vie d’une population vulnérable, que ce sont les petits gestes qui en inspirent des plus grands. 

Un dernier petit geste : N'oubliez pas de répandre le mot en partagent le lien, votre soutien est grandement apprécié :)

Merci!

story:
I'm part of a group that is donating a total of 20 new motorcycles to park rangers in Mongolia, and we deliver them by riding them there.

This requested amount only pays for the one motorcycle I will be riding and donating as part of Rally for Rangers 2015.  The ride is approximately 1200 miles over 12 days.  100% of the money you donate is tax-deductible, and goes to buy and ship the new motorcycles and equipment. I am paying my own ticket over, and the Mongol Ecology Center is not taking any of it for administration. Any additional funds past the goal will be used to help purchase other motorcycles and equipment.

Lake Hovsgol and the surrounding area is one of the last pristine places left on earth.

This is the most significant lake in Mongolia and the park covers nearly 3 million acres, an area bigger than Yellowstone National Park in the US. See Blue Waves for more history.
Imagine what Lake Tahoe or Yosemite was like 150 years ago.
Now imagine you're in a developing country with limited resources, and illegal poaching, illegal mining, and unsupervised development are all easy ways to make fast money.
Now imagine a small handful of rangers trying to patrol and protect approximately 5900 square miles on horseback, while the poachers and miners have 4x4 trucks.
The rangers we are visiting this year actually ride reindeer in the winter.

The Mongolian government has done a good job designating this area as a wildlife preserve, but the resources for enforcement are limited.

This is a chance to give the RANGERS the tools they need to help protect this ancient landscape.
This is a very unique opportunity to help protect and preserve the natural resources of a place BEFORE it gets developed or otherwise lost forever.

So many environmental causes are all about "saving", or "restoring", or "cleaning up" places that have become polluted. This is a chance to help before things get out of hand.  I don't know if you noticed, but there are a lot of people in the world. And pure natural spaces like this are few and far between.

Dirt bikes are the tools they need. 

While dirt bikes are very fun to ride, I don't think anyone would have ever thought they could help save the environment.  This is a unique situation where motorcycles are the most useful tool for the least investment. And this simple gift will make a monumental impact not just on the national park but also the individual lives of each ranger.

I'm really excited for the chance to be a part of this event. Riding a dirt bike 1200 miles across Mongolia will be a once in a lifetime experience, and a substantial physical challenge. And at the end of the day, it all goes to support a worthy cause.

 Thank you for your generosity and assistance.

Other Ways You Can Help

If any of this is interesting to you, please check out the following websites for more detailed information and history:
Blue Waves Campaign: http://www.bluewavesmongolia.org/
Mongol Ecology Center:  http://www.mongolec.org/en

story:
Short Summary

Finisia Medrano and crew are a small tribe of rewilders who are banded together by the ideal of returning to simpler and truly sustainable life way.  They do their best to walk a symbiotic life, giving back as they go, collecting and planting back wild foods Spring through Fall.  As a harsh winter is approaching, they have come into a situation that is especially difficult and requiring dollars and resources.  They have adopted 10 young feral horses from the Umatilla reservation in an effort to help them keep a healthy population on the reservation and to assist them in their rewilding work.  The size of the herd there has recently exploded and has had a negative impact on the ecosystem.  For the most part, the group subsists without the need for financial donation, however with this sudden increase in their number of horses, financial support is necessary. 

What They Need 

  • We are seeking to raise $2500 to support Finisia and tribe through the winter.  This money will be spent on hay, primary veterinary expenses and firewood.

The Impact

These horses, once a little older and trained, will play a vital role in their work. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you are in the area and are interested in donating hay, veterinary services, firewood or other horse supplies it is graciously welcomed and encouraged. 
All donations big and small are greatly appreciated as every dollar is of great help. 

If you would like to personally reach out to the group you can contact me or the group  - 
https://www.facebook.com/fuzzywarmcoyote?fref=ts
https://www.facebook.com/michael.ridge2?fref=ts
https://www.facebook.com/stephen.henry.904750?fref=ts
https://www.facebook.com/kelsey.wilber.14?fref=ts

story:
Nextmas  will take the Christmas tree to the next level by updating a tradition that is charming and festive but environmentally rapacious. First, we'll build 25 (more) prototypes, which will be used to demonstrate the product to buyers nationwide so they can carry it next Christmas season (2015).We will choose a retail chain that is environmentally conscious / has an eco-minded clientele.  By next fall, we aim to have our metal bases and branch sets available at a store near you!

In addition to prototyping, we will of course travel extensively to secure our supply chain and retail presence on a national level.

Prices are more than for a conventional or artificial Christmas tree but after a few short years of using the product, it will pay for itself. Think of it like a solar panel: initial costs are more than offset by the long-term savings and significant environmental benefits.  All materials and labor are from the U.S., which makes our product more expensive, but we sleep better at night.


(Prices include Shipping within the continental U.S.)

3 ft. Aluminum                  $150

6 ft. Aluminum                  $225

9 ft. Aluminum                  $325

3 ft. Stainless Steel         $200

6 ft. Stainless Steel         $350

9 ft. Stainless Steel         $575


Branches:

There are several sources of Christmas tree boughs for you to consider:

- Plant a donor tree and trim it each year (cheapest / "greenest"  option)

- Forage for boughs near your house if possible (easy / cheap)

- Get free trimmings at your local Christmas Tree Lot (easy / free)

- Purchase our pre-cut, fresh, hydrated branches from a local retailer's floral  department (we are in talks with two national chains as we speak!)

Branch-set prices  (not included with base):

3 ft branch set:   $30

6 ft branch set:   $50

9-ft branch set:  $70


Central Wick:

Only needed if you plan to use the tree for more than 10 days and would like to minimize needle drop.  Needle drop is minimal for the first 10 days even without the wick.


3- ft Wick:   $17

6-ft. Wick:  $27

9 ft. Wick:   $38

story:
STRETCH GOAL: Many thanks to the generous supporters who helped us reach our initial goal of $25,000! WE STILL NEED YOUR HELP to reach our stretch goal of $100,000 in order to complete all elements of the project. 

After purchasing a "perk" you will get an email from jlaskin@conservationsolutions.org who will follow up with you regarding your personal dedication that will be permanently installed on the L.A. River Greenway Trail.

Help bring nature back to the
L.A. River!

We need your help to make the L.A. River Greenway Trail a reality!
 The L.A. River is becoming a natural, cultural, and structural backbone of Los Angeles County. From President Obama to L.A. Mayor Eric Garcetti and world-renowned architect Frank Gehry, people are coming together to transform the 
L.A. River. Community Conservation Solutions’ (CCS) L.A. River Greenway Trail Project in the San Fernando Valley is a vital part of this L.A. River renaissance
and is creating a new precedent for restoring native habitat along the L.A. River. 


Help transform the L.A. River in the heart of Los Angeles. Become a permanent part of the L.A. River’s heritage by reserving one of the unique Naming Opportunities available (please see perks).

By supporting the L.A. River Greenway Trail, you become a vital part of a collaborative effort to transform all 51 miles of the L.A. River into a continuous greenway of open space, natural habitat, walking and biking trails—linking 15 cities, dozens of communities and millions of people.


Reserve your permanent place along the L.A. River today and create a permanent legacy for our children and grandchildren!

L.A. River Greenway Trail Project Transformation:

  • Bridge the Gap to create 3 miles of trail- longest in the San Fernando Valley
  • Restore Native Habitat by planting over 4,000 native trees and plants
  • Create Public Access by opening a currently closed section of the L.A. River 
  • Improve the quality of life in this park-poor area of Los Angeles

"Our roots lie deep in this land, and we are very happy that Community Conservation Solutions is helping to bring it back to a natural state.”
–Rudy Ortega Jr., Tribal President, Fernandeño Tataviam Band of Mission Indians

 





You can be a part of bringing the  
L.A. River back to life!

Community Conservation Solutions has worked hard to raise over $2 million in public funds for this L.A. River project. We need your help to raise the additional funds needed to be able to complete the project.

Your support ensures a beautifully restored native habitat and a walking trail adorned with native plants and peaceful resting areas.

With your help, we can make this permanent improvement on the L.A. River that people will enjoy for generations to come. This trail will  bring nature back to the L.A. River while providing a much-needed respite from the noise and congestion of living in urban Los Angeles.

We accept donations of all amounts and all donations are tax deductible.

Enjoy the shade and listen to the river and the birds. Imagine the young oaks and sycamores growing tall above you in the years to come.



With your help, the L.A. River will support life again!

$100 River Walker – Will you join us in the revitalization of the L.A. River? Your name or the name of a loved one will be displayed on our website for all to see!

$500 Native Tree – Beautiful native oak, sycamore and other trees will transform this barren section of the river into a flourishing sanctuary for birds and humans alike. Your name will be engraved into a paving tile at the trail's entrance.

$500 Paving Tile – Your name or the name of a loved one will be engraved into
a paving tile permanently installed at the entrance of the L.A. River Greenway Trail.

$1,000 Grove Guardian, Native Habitat Walk – Reserve your permanent place in
the Native Habitat Walk by contributing to an engraved stone plant marker that will feature your name and the name of a native plant!

$2,500 River Trail Bench – Take a break, enjoy the restored native habitat, and
let the river flow by. Comfortable river seating along the trail will give visitors
a peaceful place to rest, enjoy nature and the L.A. River. Your name will be engraved in stone next to your bench. 

$2,500 Dog Stations – The smart solution to pet pollution! These bag dispensers will allow you and your dog to do your part in helping keep the L.A. River Greenway Trail clean and attractive. Your name will be engraved at the Dog Station. 

$7,500 River Story Fence Panel – Hand-crafted metal art work tells the L.A. River’s rich and intertwined natural and human history. These beautiful River Story Fence Panels convey the L.A. River's unifying force. Your name will be engraved into the metalwork of a River Story Fence Panel.



Community Conservation Solutions
Who we are & what we do


We solve problems where people and nature intersect.
CCS’ mission is to develop innovative solutions to the challenging problems created where people and nature intersect. CCS pioneers forward-thinking and strategic changes that unite diverse communities and create permanent public benefits.

CCS has a  nearly 20 year track record of successful conservation projects.
CCS’ President, Esther Feldman, has pioneered innovative environmental initiatives for over 30 years. She is responsible for creating more than $3 billion in new public funding for conservation in L.A. County, California and throughout the United States. In 1994, she led the acquisition of the first new park along the river, launching today’s revitalization of the L.A. River.

Our work creates permanent public benefits.
CCS’ work leverages investments of public and private funds, and integrates science, technology, planning, finance and community engagement to create permanent public benefits.

Some of CCS' Past Successes
  • In the Baldwin Hills Park, CCS leveraged over $80 million in public funds to transform two square miles of oil fields in park-poor urban Los Angeles.
  • CCS purchased the L.A. Conservation Corps' permanent conservation job-training and education Spring Street Center to serve over 2,500 inner-city youth every year.
  • CCS’ Water Sustainability Program is dedicated to capturing and re-using stormwater and urban runoff on a watershed  scale, building “smart” parks
    and habitat to naturally filter pollutants to create new sources of clean, usable water. CCS’ work resulted in  passage of groundbreaking statewide stormwater legislation in 2014 that is transforming how stormwater is used throughout California. 


How you can help


Become a part of the growing movement to transform the L.A. River into a flourishing sanctuary for nature and humans alike in the heart of urban Los Angeles. 

Support the L.A. River Greenway Trail Project today by reserving a Naming Opportunity for you or a loved one that will leave a permanent legacy to benefit future generations! We will leverage your thoughtful investment in our community’s future and hope that you will consider doing the same by asking your friends and associates to join you in contributing to the L.A. River Greenway Trail Project.

If you are unable to financially support this campaign, there are still ways that you can contribute and make a difference! Please refer 5 to 10 friends (or as many as you would like) to support us using the “LINK” tool on the left hand side of this web page. If 3 or more friends support this campaign at the $500 level, we will give you a free surprise perk!

You can track your results by going to “My Profile” > Referrals.

Any contribution amount helps! We accept donations of all amounts. Please see the “contribute now” button at the top of the page.



OUR TEAM

Community Conservation Solutions 

For more information about CCS please see above or click here.


Many people are working very hard to make the L.A. River Greenway Trail  a reality.

North East Trees

North East Trees is a community based, grassroots, environmental non-profit 501(c)(3) organization. They manage all aspects of the L.A. River Greenway Trail's construction and their staff includes licensed professional arborists, landscape architects, landscape designers, and environmental scientists. 

Mia Lehrer and Associates

Mia Lehrer and Associates is a full service, international landscape architecture firm located in Los Angeles, California. The firm designed the L.A. River Greenway Project and has led the planning, design and implementation of a diverse range of public and private projects. 

Land IQ

Land IQ specializes in providing solutions to challenging agricultural and environmental problems. They maintain a staff of soil scientists, agronomists, ecologists, and remote sensing and GIS specialists. Land IQ designed the ecosystem-based habitat restoration for the L.A. River Greenway Trail Project.  

VCA Engineers, Inc. 

VCA has made a major impact as one of the premier engineering firms in Los Angeles by providing unique personal approaches and techniques to its projects. VCA conducted the engineering critical to designing the L.A. River Greenway Trail Project. 

Mountains Recreation and Conservation Authority 

The Mountains Recreation and Conservation Authority (MRCA) is a local government agency established in 1985 pursuant to the Joint Powers Act. The MRCA is dedicated to the preservation and management of local open space and parkland, watershed lands, trails, wildlife habitat, and is one of the lead agencies revitalizing the Los Angeles River. The MRCA will perform the long-term maintenance of the L.A. River Greenway Trail. 

Owen Gabbert Designs 

Using both modern and traditional metalworking techniques, Owen Gabbert creates meticulously  hand-crafted works of metal art that combine organic and geometric elements. Through bending, casting, welding and exceptional attention to detail, Gabbert transforms each concept into a work of art. Owen designed all of the River Story Fence Panels and the River and Mountains Entry Gate. 


CONSTRUCTION BEGINS on the L.A. RIVER GREENWAY TRAIL!

Construction began this fall and we anticipate completion by Fall of 2016.
