story:
Who are we?

The Yepez family has been protecting Sea Turtles on the coast of Veracruz, Mexico since 1967 and today Fundación Yepez protects 43km of beach and over 1000 adult female turtles (Kemp´s Ridley and Green Turtle) that nest every year between March and November. We also protect their nests as well as their hatchlings, approx. 100 per nest, which have a survival to adulthood statistic of 1 per 1000!

We also work on several other environmental projects such as reforestation, recycling, community projects and environmental education - all closely related with sea turtle conservation. 

What do we need?

We are looking for help to fund the start of the season of 2013.

We need $5000 to be able to:

  • Repair our quadbikes
  • Buy gasoline
  • Pay small salaries to our 3 permanent staff 
  • To buy and repair necessary equipment such as flashlights, cameras, rainproof clothing, material and medicine to transport and treat injured or ill sea turtles etc.

This project is over 45 years old and every cent raised goes directly towards the protection and conservation of the endangered sea turtles (whether we receive $50 or $5000) We invite you to come and visit us and join us on the beach to see these amazing animals nest or to observe as the hatchlings emerge from their nests and make their way to the ocean, so that you too can see with your own eyes their beauty and importance to the ecosystems and understand that we MUST protect them from extinction.

Why help?

There is perhaps no creature more global than the sea turtle. Traveling across all the great oceans, they lay their eggs on beaches around the world. The small baby turtles emerge from the sand on these shores, and if they are lucky enough to reach adulthood, they embark on journeys that mark thousands of miles and many international waters. The increasing hazards, from poachers to pollution, fishing nets to invasion of their nesting habitat, are killing these animals at a fast rate. Sea turtles have been on this planet over 150 million years but if we do not act fast, they will die out. Please help us in our mission to protect them and their habitat.

How can YOU help?

There are many ways to help us:

  • Donate to this campaign!
  • Come and help us on the beach, give your TIME to the sea turtles!
  • Let businesses know that we are eligible to receive tax-deductible contributions internationally!
  • Please help us reach more people with this campaign, the more people we can reach, the more turtles we can save so pass this link on!

Thank you, for your time and your contribution!

Sincerely,

The whole team at

Fundación Yepez A.C.

www.tortugasfundacionyepez.com

story:
Trees for Zambia Explained

Trees for Zambia is a reforestation and environmental education project based in Livingstone, Zambia. It was launched in July 2012 with a 3-week tree planting event and was followed by an ongoing campaign to inspire awareness about deforestation, climate change, tree planting, environmental sustainability and alternative energy sources. With this project, we aim to fight the drastic deforestation in the area by getting people active about making sustainble changes. Trees for Zambia 2013 is a second campaign to boost the projct. 

During Trees for Zambia 2013, which runs from July 7 - 28, we'll do the following:

  • Plant 5000 trees at schools, on subsistence farms and in deforested areas.
  • Host educational workshops for schools children and subsistence farmers 
  • Teach community members how to build solar cookers, in an effort to move people away from their depence on charcaol
  • Set up micro tree nurseries in the local communities. We will buy the trees back from these nurseries and plant them as part of our project. This will both provide livelihoods and create value for trees.

Trees for Zambia is a project by Greenpop, a social enterprise based in Cape Town, South Africa. At Greenpop, our aim is to inspire a fun an accessible green movement; the Treevolution.



Sustainability of the Project 

In order to make this project sustainable, it is essential to have the local community involved in and benefiting from our efforts. The main way of ensuring this is through education. We are working with education experts to develop the most suitable and fun educational material for both school children en subsistence farmers. Through our workshops, the local community will learn how trees can benefit them, whether it's by using them for food security reasons, knowing how to identify trees with the best shade, or using them as natural fertilizers on their land. In addition, we ensure local community members profit from the trees through our micro-nursery enterprise. 

What We Need & What You Get

1. We need trees! Every $13 covers for a tree, and all the logistics that are involved in planting that tree. This includes the following costs: 

  • buying the trees and necessary compost from local nurseries in Livingstone 
  • transporting the trees to the planting locations
  • facilitation of the planting day with the local community and international volunteers
  • environmental education that is an essential part of our project
  • a monitoring program of the trees, so that we can make sure they grow tall and strong! 

2. We need educational material! Every $10 allows us to produce educational worksheets for a school, which will help us teach children about the value of trees and the environment.

3. We need seed boxes! After planting trees at a school, we would like to give all children at the school their own box with a seed. We'll teach them how to look after their own little tree! This will cost $2,50 per seed box.

Please note that even if the goal is not reached, all the donated trees will be planted, and all the education material will be implemented. The Trees for Zambia project is ongoing - we would just like to plant as many trees and spread as much awareness as possible! Other sources of income are corporate sponsorship (please contact us if you're interested in this!) and private donations.

It doesn't matter how much you contribute - every tree counts!! Check out our perks for cool things we offer you in return. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Join our Treevolution by helping us spread the message! Please share this campaign with anyone you think might be interested in helping us green Zambia! 

You can also come and volunteer with us in Zambia! We fully rely on volunteers to make the project a success, so roll up your sleeves and help us out! For more information on our volunteer project, send an email to zambia@greenpop.org. 
 
Thanks for your TREEmendous support!!

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it’s important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it’s going. Be transparent and specific—people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don’t reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
Short Summary:

Hello, my name is Stephen Tolpinrud. I am 26 years old and I recently finished a certificate in Agroecology from UCSC. The certificate, which was obtained while living, working, and studying on a farm, taught me how to grow food using organic methods.  The experience impacted me viscerally.  Since then I have been impassioned to make a difference. That is why this spring I will be riding my bicycle from New York City, NY to Astoria, OR. I want to use the ride as a catalyst to bring awareness to and fundraise for the construction of a greenhouse and water well for a community in Northern Nicaragua. With the help and guidance of a local non-profit, Waves of Hope, I plan on completing the project during the month of July.

El Manzano Uno, the community I will be working with, currently lacks the ability to grow food consistently throughout the year.  This is due to pesky animals, extreme weather, and a lack of consistent water supply. Having a greenhouse will provide the community with the resources to grow healthy, sustainable, and consistent food all year long.  This will undoubtedly have a profound impact on the local ecology, by decreasing the community’s dependency on packaged and processed foods, and it will help to create a healthier populace by providing a consistent source of nutrient rich, fresh, and organic foods.

 

What We Need:

Waves of Hope and I are asking for $4,000 dollars to complete the project.

 $1,400 for the materials of greenhouse

  • Structural supports
  • Vented siding
  • Polyurethane roofing
  • Tables to place seedlings
  • Architectural template
  • Seedling trays, water cans, and etc.

 $1,000 for the construction of a water well

          This will be built by a third-party, but I will assist in it’s creation.

 $1,600 for the financing of an individual to monitor seedlings long after I depart and to purchase and needed supplies.

  • This will be monitored by the directors of the non-profit, Waves of Hope, whom I will be working closely with.

 *Key component of the project will be that all funding will go directly to the construction of the greenhouse and it’s materials, a water well, and to an individual who will monitor the seedlings. No funding will go towards my travel expenses, nor will it be spent on the non-profits overhead; that is because Waves of Hope functions with zero overhead.

 *Any access funding will be deposited into a Waves of Hope account, which will pay for an individual to monitor the plants and allow for the purchasing of any necessary supplies in the future.

 

The Impact and Other Ways You Can Help:

Every dollar that is donated will go directly towards the promotion of a more sustainable human society. Conventional food and agricultural sectors have an immense impact on the world’s life providing ecosystems. By creating more local sources of food that do not require thousands of miles of transportation; energy intensive pesticides; and monocultural practices, which inhibit natures natural tendency to diversify, we will be promoting a more stable environment, where by we can all thrive.

If a financial donation is not plausible for you then please do the next best thing and pass this site on to other folks by linking it to facebook, twitter, or by e-mailing who ever you think would be interested.  The more people that check out this page the better!

I am confident that with my previous experience of working on a farm and by helping a friend construct a greenhouse recently I have the skill sets to complete this project.  All that is needed is the funding and with your help more people will be eating tomatoes from the vine, while promoting a more sustainable society.

story:
I have always been passionate about this planet and conservation; about finding ways to reverse the negative impact we, as humans, have brought upon earth's creatures. This volunteer program I have enrolled in (July 22nd- August 3rd) is specifically for the conservation of endangered sea turtles in Fiji, and I could not be more excited to be a part of it! This program involves a week of orientation, where we learn the skills needed to care for injured and diseased turtles as well as how to make hatching sites safe for mama turtles and their hatchlings. After that week volunteers begin duties cleaning beaches, turtle tanks, and hatching eggs. In addition to work at the conservation site we will alternate assisting at local primary schools and with light construction in the villages. I am blessed to have a job with an airline, where the expenses for air travel are significantly discounted; the funding i am trying to raise will cover my boarding, the program fees, and meals during my two week stay. I am currently in contact with the head of the program and discussing needed supplies. I am hoping to have enough extra to be able to pack and check bags full to bring as donations when we arrive. This is my attempt to do more than just "like" and "share" articles about the need for change; This is my attempt to make a difference, starting one sea turtle at a time:)

Endangered Fiji Turtle Facts

http://www.wcsfiji.com/Wildlife/Turtles.aspx

IVHQ Volunteer Information

https://www.volunteerhq.org/volunteer-in-fiji

story:
WHAT IS THE PROBLEM?

The City of Eugene Planning Commission has tentatively approved the Oakleigh Meadow Co-housing (OMC) Planned unit Development (PUD) application which would allow multi-family development within the Willamette Greenway at the east end of Oakleigh Lane. The burden is now on the neighborhood to show the Land Use Board of Appeals that this type of development does not belong in a small, quiet neighborhood with inadequate street access. We can’t expect that we won’t have development within the Urban Growth Boundary, but maxing out the density, building 90 foot long condominiums, more than doubling the traffic on Oakleigh, and supporting similar infill in the neighborhood is not compatible with the existing neighborhood. It is also not compatible with the Willamette Greenway.

Eugene Code requires that the streets serving a new PUD be “safe and adequate.” The proposed PUD would nearly double the traffic, and the Eugene Public Works Department (PWD) assessment determined that new and current residents, pedestrians and bicyclists would be at risk unless Oakleigh Lane were widened and improved to the City’s adopted street standards. The City Planning Department ignored the PWD’s evaluation, they even decreased the PWD’s previous determination of the required width and has tentatively approved the development.  Also, the width currently allowed by the Planning Department does not meet State or City Fire access requirements. 

We urge you to help us protect the established R-1, single-family neighborhood and retain open space and natural areas in the Greenway. Please help us save single family neighborhoods and the Greenway. Our future depends on it.

HOW WILL FUNDS BE USED?

The local neighborhood has been fighting this development for 2 years through appeals. The project was already remanded by the Oregon Court of Appeals and The State land Use Board of Appeals (LUBA) due to procedural and substantive land use errors. The City of Eugene Planning Department, once again has approved the development with several procedural errors and several substantive land use errors. The local neighborhood is again appealing the decision at LUBA. We believe we have very solid standing for the LUBA appeal.  However, we need funding to support the appeal. The local neighborhood needs to raise approximately $15,000 to pay for attorney fees. Neighbors have already raised substantial funding for previous appeals and we have a committed group of supporters that will continue to find a solution.

The money raised in this campaign will be used for the upcoming LUBA appeal and for additional appeals, if possible. 

WHAT IS THE SOLUTION?

The neighborhood has offered compromise and even attempted mediation with OMC early in the application process. OMC has never offered a compromise on size, never acknowledged the neighbor’s concerns about road safety and increased traffic and ironically, have never acknowledged the importance of the Greenway.  The neighbors have been educating the rest of the neighborhood through fliers, posters, potlucks, and yard sale fundraisers. We have also explained our concerns with the neighborhood association. The neighborhood continues to try to find a solution for both parties. 

Some possible solutions are:

·  The PUD (land use application) gets denied by the City due to inadequate road standards and successful appeals at LUBA and potentially at Court of Appeals, reducing the size significantly.

·  A portion of the property is purchased by the City Parks Department, reducing the size of the development and preserving some open space.

·  All of the property gets purchased by the City Parks Department for open space and preservation of open space in the Willamette Greenway.

WHERE IS THE MEADOW AND WHY IS IT UNIQUE?

Oakleigh Meadow is located at the east end of two dead-end streets, Oakleigh Lane and McClure Lane. The meadow is adjacent to City-owned park land along the west side of the Willamette River along the Ruth-Bascom West Bank multi-use path. The meadow is fully within the Willamette River Greenway and one-third of the property is below the 100 year floodplain.  In order to develop the property to the extent OMC is planning, approximately 1500 cubic yards of fill will be needed to bring the grade to national flood insurance standards.

From the City parkland along the bike path, people can view a variety of wildlife, such as bald eagles, hawks, owls, osprey, beavers, flickers plus much more. Apple, fir, and cedar trees are common on the periphery of the meadow. Children playing, dogs running, and neighbors and others socializing are common activities in the adjacent parkland meadow. OMC has not defined the east private property and as such many people use the meadow just like the City parkland. This is a special area that should be preserved, and not developed into 29 unit towering condominiums. 

WHO WE ARE?

We are the neighbors who live on Oakleigh and McClure Lanes, and supporters from the area. We are neighbors in an established modest single-family residential neighborhood. We believe in Oregon’s robust land use laws, including urban growth boundaries, and appropriate infill policies. We do not believe in destroying what’s left of the Willamette River Greenway within the City. We also do not believe that safety should be compromised for intense densification. In addition, we believe in following rules and code, all of which have been developed in order to balance infill with neighborhood livability.

We are also part of the timely movement throughout Eugene to sustain single-family neighborhoods, and to fight the City’s unbalanced infill attempts. By appealing this PUD, not only will the City Planning Department be directed to follow their own rules, we will be setting a precedent to preserve single-family neighborhoods throughout Eugene.

FOR MORE INFORMATION

Visit our website: www.saveoakleighlane.com

Join us on Facebook:https://www.facebook.com/groups/208401309335935/

Or Email at: greenway@saveoakleighlane.com

WHAT ELSE CAN YOU DO TO HELP?

Tell your friends, spread the word, and use Indiegogo share tools to direct them to our campaign.

story:
We are a group of students from the international master of ''Resource Economics and Sustainable Development'' from the University of Bologna. We attended to the two last editions of the EuroEnviro and inspired by purposes and motivations of the event, we presented a project proposal to host the symposium for the very first time in Italy. We have been awarded after a democratic vote and we seized with enthusiasm the opportunity to organize EuroEnviro 2017. Rimini will have the pleasure to host this insightful event from the 21st to the 27th of May.

The week of EuroEnviro will combine the academic program with leisure activities. The symposium will be structured in morning lectures given by experts, from both the academic and professional fields, related to the macro-topics of Waste Management, Food Management and Sustainable Tourism analyzed every day with a focus on different micro-topics. These micro-topics will be: Sea, Adaptation Strategy and Life-Styles. Workshops aimed at developing functional projects will be hosted by professionals of Climate-KIC in the afternoon. These final outcomes will be presented by the participants and awarded during an interactive exhibition open to the public that will have the opportunity to get in touch with this stimulating context.

The main goal of EuroEnviro 2017 is to offer a high-quality academic program designed to stimulate democratic debates and creative ideas related to the selected topics. The purpose is to face the challenges and struggles of the field, offer practical tools of problem-solving and develop possible projects. The cross-cutting objective is to create a synergic environment open to the cultural exchange between the participants and with the local community.

EuroEnviro is a non-profit meeting with a long tradition. Every year students from international universities voluntarily take the opportunity to organize this event which requires a lot of work, commitment and passion for the environment. The students attending the symposium will pay for their accommodation and food but we need funds to cover the expenditures for the necessary venues, the equipment for the workshops and the travel-fees of the speakers.

 

We've decided to put our project on Indiegogo because even if only the students will be allowed to participate, the outcomes of the week will be practical and innovative solutions to current environmental issues. This is clearly a concern of all the Earth population.

 

Donate for EuroEnviro, support young minds and give Earth a chance.

 

http://www.euroenviro.org/

https://www.facebook.com/euroenviro/

story:
I am a social entrepreneur who has been campaigning for action on climate change for 25 years. 

Time is running out for us. We have to speed up. My idea begins with the publication of  a declaration in an international newspaper, signed by more than a hundred of the winners of the world’s environmental prizes, saying why we believe the global community can no longer delay meaningful action on global warming, and calling on foundations and philanthropists to throw at least a part of their endowments into the fight while there is still time.

If some of them respond, this would provide the first of the two new pools of capital for bankrolling climate action. If companies and investors see foundations and philanthropists leading this way, they too may join in. 

Given that most greenhouse-gas emissions come from fossil-fuel use, much of that new money would go to building new clean energy projects and companies, and boosting existing ones. The key to the second part of the idea is that beneficiaries of the new capital would only receive that money if they donate 5% of their profits to the same mission: fighting global warming.  That provides the second new pool of capital.

If the project succeeds, the prize will be huge and enduring. If clean energy is to replace fossil-fuels to the extent that will be needed to win the war on global warming in the years ahead, some clean-energy companies will grow like the stars of the internet age, and other new kinds of companies will also be set up, many of them rooted in community ownership. As well as fighting global warming, the profits for all these entities will be promoting development in poor countries, big time. 

I know this idea can work, in principle. I have done it, in microcosm, with the solar energy company I set up because of my concerns about global warming and other aspects of fossil-fuel dependency, Solarcentury. We give 5% of our annual profits to a charity we created, SolarAid, which has itself created a retail brand, SunnyMoney, that has become the biggest retailer of solar lighting in Africa in just a few years, knocking out oil use for lighting. As we grow, SunnyMoney will be recycling 100% of our profits to the mission.

To start the campaign, I need to raise £30k in the next month. Most of it will pay for the publication of the declaration. Any left over will go to a PR campaign to help all the declaration signatories - many of the most experienced and respected environmentalists in the world - follow up on the declaration. (And yes, they have already agreed to sign it!). 

Why can't Solarcentury pay this £30k? Because I only own 9% of the company. Why can't SolarAid pay for it? It's a brand new idea. We didn't pitch it to our existing funders. 

If you have any questions, I will be running a Q&A on my website: http://www.jeremyleggett.net/about/campaign/

My e-mail is jeremy.leggett@solarcentury.com

Please help if you can.

story:
Drone Research, Inc.is a newly formed nonprofit located in Columbus, Ohio.

The Mission of Drone Research, Inc.

Drone Research, Inc.’s mission is to share knowledge of building and using low-cost unmanned aerial vehicles for conservation, agriculture, environmental research, disaster, and search and rescue with researchers/nonprofits organizations worldwide. Drone Research, Inc.works closely with all groups to help them understand the use of drones for their particular applications and/or purposes. Drone Research, Inc. also works with children with disabilities allowing them a chance to fly and explore without leaving the ground.

We have started this campaign to raise money for some desperately needed equipment to allow us to fulfill our mission. Our current equipment only allows us short flight spans, which require numerous flights to survey large land areas for farmers and other nonprofits. Equipment with a flight time of 2 hours or more will thus allow us to scan larger parcels of land in 1 flight instead of having to stop every 10 minutes or so to change batteries.

Farming - Our free service to farmers allows us to do full aerial shots of crops which able the famers to see affected areas of crops or their fields. This will allow the farmer to treat the affected areas, which in result will benefit the crops. In 1 hour time, we can fly approximately a 500 acre farm. In comparison, this same task would take a farmer many hours to walk the same size area looking for problems with their crops.

Environmental Research - We have been contacted by numerous environmental nonprofits who do great work with our land and waterways. These nonprofits restore waterways and land areas and much more. Your donation would allow us within minutes to give them aerial shots of their projects before they start working, making it more efficient for them to see what type of work needs to be done from high above. This would save many environmental groups hours of walking in order to accomplish the same objective. It would also allow them to see their progress along the way much easier and compare the before and after of their completed projects.

Kids With Disabilities - This project has a special place in all our hearts. Many kids with disabilities are confined to wheel chairs and never get a chance to see what it is like from above. With our drone project, the kids would wear a special pair of glasses, which would enable them to see directly through the camera as we fly. This is known as a first person view. You would be amazed at the kids faces and smiles when all of the sudden they are viewing the world from 200 feet above the ground without ever having to leave it.

Below is a video taken of Niagara Falls in first person view. When the UAV takes off, what you are seeing is what is being viewed out of the goggles. You are experiencing something amazing, and the kids will never forget it.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cfoLYTKObiU

As you can see above, your small donation will go a long way in helping many people. We understand that times are tough for many people; however, we hope you will make a donation. We have donations available from $10 to $500. Thank you for your time and God Bless.

Ashley Krutko

Drone Research Inc. CEO

A little bit about Ashley.

Ashley is a Graduate of Capital University with a major in Environmental Science and a minor in Biology. Ashley’s passion for the environment and helping others is why she has a great love for this project.

Ashley is also our pilot at Drone Research Inc.

Please also check out our new Website

http://www.droneresearch.org

 Our new Facebook page...

https://www.facebook.com/pages/Drone-Research/513098645479201

How We Will Use The Money...

1- Two Drone/Uav  Flying Units - $1500.00

2- Two Drone/Uav Transmitters - $700-$800

3- One Ground Station- $2000.00

4- Misc. Electronic Equipment - $ 500- $ 700

Total- $4500- $5000
story_txt: Drone Research, Inc.is a newly formed nonprofit located in Columbus, Ohio.The Mission of Drone Research, Inc. Drone Research, Inc.’s mission is to share knowledge of building and using low-cost unmanned aerial vehicles for conservation, agriculture, environmental research, disaster, and search and rescue with researchers/nonprofits organizations worldwide. Drone Research, Inc.works closely with all groups to help them understand the use of drones for their particular applications and/or purposes. Drone Research, Inc. also works with children with disabilities allowing them a chance to fly and explore without leaving the ground.We have started this campaign to raise money for some desperately needed equipment to allow us to fulfill our mission. Our current equipment only allows us short flight spans, which require numerous flights to survey large land areas for farmers and other nonprofits. Equipment with a flight time of 2 hours or more will thus allow us to scan larger parcels of land in 1 flight instead of having to stop every 10 minutes or so to change batteries. Farming - Our free service to farmers allows us to do full aerial shots of crops which able the famers to see affected areas of crops or their fields. This will allow the farmer to treat the affected areas, which in result will benefit the crops. In 1 hour time, we can fly approximately a 500 acre farm. In comparison, this same task would take a farmer many hours to walk the same size area looking for problems with their crops.Environmental Research - We have been contacted by numerous environmental nonprofits who do great work with our land and waterways. These nonprofits restore waterways and land areas and much more. Your donation would allow us within minutes to give them aerial shots of their projects before they start working, making it more efficient for them to see what type of work needs to be done from high above. This would save many environmental groups hours of walking in order to accomplish the same objective. It would also allow them to see their progress along the way much easier and compare the before and after of their completed projects.Kids With Disabilities - This project has a special place in all our hearts. story:
Hi!  Thanks for stopping by to learn about this project.

My name is Dr. Debra Durham and I am a wildlife biologist. I started working with chimpanzees in Uganda in 2010.  I fell in love with the animals, made some great friends and quickly realized that Uganda is one of my favorite places on the planet. I continue to be part of wildlife projects there and have been back several times, most recently in May 2013.

Smart + Heart: In addition to being a scientist, I also happen to be committed to a life of compassion. That's how Compassion in Action became part of the project name. I think the best solutions to the world's problems are kind to people, animals and the earth.** Projects for wildlife are no exception!

This is my campaign for (drumroll, please...)

the Compassion in Action Mushroom Project, or CAMP for short.

CAMP is a brand new program that will help women build sustainable micro-businesses growing and selling mushrooms. CAMP promotes alternative sustainable livelihoods in conjunction with chimpanzee conservation.

Why CAMP for chimps?

A smart program to reduce human-wildlife conflict and protect wildlife recognizes that empowering people and communities is vital. This is one of the reasons why alternative sustainable livelihoods projects are so important for protecting wildlife, including chimpanzees in Uganda.

I first learned about the possibility of this project back in November 2012. I was in Uganda meeting with colleagues at Chimpanzee Sanctuary and Wildlife Conservation Trust (CSWCT). As you can see, working for chimps is work we all love:

It's Summer 2013 and I haven't been able to stop thinking about the mushroom project idea for months. I finally decided I wanted to do what I could to just make it happen.  That's why I put together this funding campaign to ask other smart, compassionate folks to get behind the project with me.  I hope that will include you.

Here's why I'm so excited about CAMP:

  • Green: Small footprint. Solar drying. No impacts on the forest habitat.
  • Healthy: Mushrooms are not only delicious, they are nutritious!
  • Compassionate: No animals are harmed, no conflict with wildlife.

What CAMP needs and what it will do

The plan for CAMP has two phases that will take us about 8 months.

Phase 1: Piloting the project

The pilot project will provide training and materials to women so they can grow, preserve and sell mushrooms. Business development support will also be offered.

  • After women are recruited to participate in the pilot, CAMP will buy materials and labor to construct mushroom sheds
  • CAMP will provide each woman with supplies to start her mushroom micro-business.
  • CAMP will fund one or two solar dryers at a local education center.
  • Training and ongoing support for growing, preserving and marketing mushrooms will be provided through CAMP funds.

Other CAMP funds will help put boots on the ground to get the ball rolling, keep things moving forward and adjust course as needed. We want to be smart and responsive as we work so the project can pivot to meet needs and opportunities along the way.

Phase 2: Building on our success

After 6 months, we will go over the project data to figure out what worked best and what needs to be tweaked (or just scrapped) so the project can get better and grow in the future.

What you get for supporting CAMP

In recognition of your compassion and support, I've come up with a range of perks, from gorgeous chimpanzee photos to exclusive online project diaries or even a fun, original chimpanzee-themed thank you song composed and recorded just for you.

Cue Moulin Rouge theme song: "Voulez-vous manger des champignons avec CAMP?"

For those who can drop a bigger chunk of change,  a special project wrap dinner party is a fabulous option. It will include a delicious, homemade, mushroom-themed dinner for you and a guest at Chez Deb. (You must be able to come to Seattle. See other details for this perk, too).

Are you absolutely in love with CAMP? Super special perk alert!

You can adopt this project! Whether it's because you love chimps or champignons, or just think that a cool vegan project deserves a chance, your support will be rewarded with the most special of perks: a chance to join us in Uganda to be part of CAMP activities. You will also get to enjoy some delicious, nutritious mushroom dishes (say that three times fast!) at a CAMP team dinner in the field! Please see other special details for this perk.

CAMP is a great project all around

Green
Sustainable
Healthy
Humane
Reduces human-wildlife conflict
Promotes livelihoods for women and families
 
Plus, mushrooms are yummy!

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can’t contribute right now, you can still make a difference for the chimpanzees and the Compassion in Action Mushroom Project (CAMP):

  • Help get the word out and build interest in this compassionate project.  It's easy: just use the Indiegogo share tools! That’s all there is to it.
  • Eat more mushrooms (and other fruits and veggies).
  • Learn about Uganda and chimpanzees. Tell others about what you have learned.
  • Practice compassion toward people, animals and the earth.

 

**Doctor Deb's notes about why she favors the approach embodied by Compassion in Action:

Approaches that trade the lives of some animals for others, but expect a positive net improvement in the world don't make much sense to my head or my heart. The science is in on this: more animal agriculture and more animal-based foods aren't real solutions because they aren't green, sustainable or healthy.  That's why I think it is so important to find and develop solutions that are smart and kind at heart, like CAMP.

Administrivia: I know that it would be possible to start a non-profit and file the various paperwork so CAMP support could count as charitable donations. That's a later step in my mind.  What needs to come first is a pilot that can be tested in the field and help us figure things out sooner rather than later. Once things are tested and proven so the project can scale, then new infrastructure and administration can be put in place or other organizations could take over funding efforts, etc. I'm aiming for quick and agile so we can make a difference while we learn.

A pilot makes good sense, but it isn't free. I don't want to delay. Human wildlife conflict is a serious risk for chimpanzees - TODAY.  Alternative sustainable livelihoods are needed - NOW. I want to see this pilot project get started ASAP! Thanks for your help making that hope a reality.

story:
**WOW. We passed our initial goal in just 72 hours. THANK YOU!!! If you'd like to participate in the writing and editing of this book, and be recognized in the first special edition, pre-order your copy now.***

 

 

HELP US EXPOSE BIG ENERGY'S LIES & QUITE POSSIBLY SAVE THE WORLD

 

Okay, that's a bit dramatic, but only just. The oil & gas industry is lying to you. And the consequences of these lies affect you and everyone you know. These consequences aren't esoteric, or limited to prices at the gas pump. They shape the very face of the planet and impact the quality of life of every living creature. Help us fight back against Big Energy's billion-dollar spin machine.

The Story
We’re being told that – thanks to technological advances like hydraulic fracturing and horizontal drilling – the US is undergoing an energy revolution, leading us in a few short years to become once again the world’s biggest oil producer and an exporter of natural gas. According to the Oil & Gas Industry and their proponents, “fracking” will provide the US with energy security, low energy prices for the foreseeable future, more than a million jobs, and economic growth. And they tell us that we can frack our way to independence without hurting the environment.

 

The Reality
This is nonsense. The energy abundance of the so-called "Shale Revolution" will be short-lived, while the environmental, economic and societal costs of this drilling frenzy will last for generations.

Help us expose these lies and turn the tide in the ultimate fight against greed by pre-ordering and participating in the writing and editing of Richard Heinberg's next book, SNAKE OIL! How Big Energy's Promise of Plenty Imperils Our Future.

ABOUT THE AUTHOR:

Richard Heinberg is the author of ten books, including The End of Growth: Adapting to Our New Economic Reality, Peak Everything: Waking up to a Century of Declines and The Party's Over: Oil, War & the Fate of Industrial Societies. His books have been translated into 15 languages and sold over 250,000 copies. He's lectured widely around the world and is Senior Fellow at Post Carbon Institute, a nonprofit think tank that recently released this groundbreaking report that exposes the fossil fuel industry's grossly exaggerated inventory and economic projections. 

SNAKE OIL WILL BE FINISHED AND PRINTED BY JULY 1, 2013.

WHAT WE NEED:

  • $5500: This small amount will cover the book's publishing costs. These include the cover art, layout, formatting, interior design, conversion to ebook and, we hope, just a smidgeon of marketing. Any additional funds will go toward putting free copies into the hands of anti-fracking activists, to equip them with powerful and unassailable arguments.   

  • Your Participation: Using the Community Engagement Model of publishing, we're inviting those interested in this hugely significant topic to weigh in as Richard's editors as he moves through the writing process. We'll also ask for your thoughts on the cover artwork and overall distribution strategy. SNAKE OIL is a print-on-demand book, meaning it will be shipped to you as soon as it's finished. 

WHAT YOU GET:

  • Hopefully, more than anything, a WIN. That is, a book that, like Richard's previous work, has a direct impact on public opinion, behavior and legislature. 
  • Beyond that, as you'll see in the perks, we'll provide to you a special edition of the book, autographed copies, limited edition art prints and all kinds of recognition for recognizing that this is a critical fight at a critical time.
  • Participation: You get to help shape a book that will have a real impact.
  • A copy of the book! For those who pre-order at the $20 and above mark, you'll get a limited edition "Merry Band of Editors" version. 

THE IMPACT:

This isn't a symbolic protest. Or an online call to change the world through LIKES and SHARES. No, this is a real world book. And historically, few human endeavors have had as much impact as the written word, especially when its put in the hands of motivated citizens out to shift the public conversation.

Yes, Big Oil can outspend all of us, but they can only fool us into complacency if we let them.


SOME OF OUR OTHER RECENT PROJECTS:

Shalebubble + Drill Baby Drill Report

Animation: Don't Worry, Drive On: Fossil Fools & Fracking Lies

Animation: Who Killed Economic Growth?

Campaign: Energy Reality

Book: Energy--Overdevelopment & the Delusion of Endless Growth

Book: Rebuilding the Foodshed: How to Create Local, Sustainable and Secure Food Systems

News Portal: Resilience.org

story:
My name is Katie Yankowski and I am extremely passionate about this planet and its incredible inhabitants.

      Nature has always been of incomparable value to me, even as a little kid. Having grown up in the Midwest, I spent a great deal of time wandering through wetlands, climbing & falling out of my fair share of trees, following creeks & streams til they ran dry, catching frogs, calling out to robins, sparrows, chickadees and cardinals, and coming back home with leaves in my hair, dirt on my hands, and grass stains coloring my knees and elbows. I vividly remember running through the snow blanketed prairie in my backyard with my dog, looking up into the night sky and whispering to the stars, the wind and the trees how I loved them so. What might seem a bit strange or foreign to some was what made me who I am today.

     You see, "nature strolls" were a normal part of mine & my Mom's everyday life. She instilled in me from a young age the importance of living life fully, because our time on this planet is fleeting and must be full of awareness, appreciation and amazement of the little details all around us. The second set of stars sparkling in between blades of tall grasses, the coo of doves on a misty morning, the filtering of soft white light through budding leaves in spring time, the chorus of coyote voices rising for a few wild moments before settling back into a nighttime hush... These were all things that fulfilled us, that inspired and kept us content even in our most trying times. 

 

     Because I'm such a nature nerd, I have chosen to pursue another set of races in order to raise money in the name of wildlife and Mama Earth!

Illinois Wildlife Medical Clinic:

A nonprofit clinic that cares for more than 1,000 native wildlife a year.  The veterinary students and faculty of the UIllinois campus work hard each day to rehab animals in need and  to protect the creatures that make this planet so vivd with life!

American Forests Organization:

Over the last 20 years, the American Forest Organizarion has planted more than 40 million trees around the world, restoring forest ecosystems that have been damaged by wildfire, disease, insects, drought, development and other natural and man-made causes.  They are extremely dedicated to educating the public about the many benefits of trees and forests. After all, the more we know, the more we realize that these are limited natural resources that we just can't do without.  (They make the Earth so beau-tree-ful!)  

In hopes that taking some physical feats will help my cause to raise money for some very worthwhile charities, I've chosen the following races to rock out in the coming months:

April 7th - I will be running 10 miles of trail in the forest surrounding Homer Lake in Champaign, IL to benefit the Illinois Wildlife Medical Clinic.

April 27th - I'll participate in the Illinois half-marathon for the second time, and will sweat out another 13 miles in the name of trees that give us the oxygen we breathe while jogging and walking our way across this great planet!

June 9th - I will take on the full triathlon in the ever-so scenic Winona, MN-- and you better believe that I'll be absorbing the beauty of the landscape, reflecting on all of the good that your donations will help bring about!

 

 Together, we can help better the well-being of our planet and the beautiful array of life that it supports!

    • With all donations With all donations $30 or more, you will receive a photo print of one of Earth's many little beauties and personalized message thanking you for your awesomeness.
    • With all donations of $50 or more, you will receive a nature-inspired drawing by yours truly.

 


 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, no worries!  That doesn't mean you can't help!

  • Get the word out about this campaign and make some noise in honor of this rad world we live in! 
  • Get out into nature and breathe deep - strengthen your appreciate for the world around you.  Take a friend!  Go on an epic adventure together!
  • "Liking" the Illinois Wildlife Medical Clinic and the American Forests on Facebook is a great way to see all of the strides being made towards a more animal-friendly world.

http://www.facebook.com/UIWMC

http://www.facebook.com/AmericanForests

     Because I'm such a nature nerd, I have chosen to pursue another set of races in order to raise money in the name of wildlife and Mama Earth!
Illinois Wildlife Medical Clinic:
A nonprofit clinic that cares for more than 1,000 native wildlife a year.  The veterinary students and faculty of the UIllinois campus work hard each day to rehab animals in need and  to protect the creatures that make this planet so vivd with life!
American Forests Organization:
Over the last 20 years, the American Forest Organizarion has planted more than 40 million trees around the world, restoring forest ecosystems that have been damaged by wildfire, disease, insects, drought, development and other natural and man-made causes.  They are extremely dedicated to educating the public about the many benefits of trees and forests. After all, the more we know, the more we realize that these are limited natural resources that we just can't do without.  (They make the Earth so beau-tree-ful!)  
In hopes that taking some physical feats will help my cause to raise money for some very worthwhile charities, I've chosen the following races to rock out in the coming months:
April 7th - I will be running 10 miles of trail in the forest surrounding Homer Lake in Champaign, IL to benefit the Illinois Wildlife Medical Clinic.
April 27th - I'll participate in the Illinois half-marathon for the second time, and will sweat out another 13 miles in the name of trees that give us the oxygen we breathe while jogging and walking our way across this great planet!
June 9th - I will take on the full triathlon in the ever-so scenic Winona, MN-- and you better believe that I'll be absorbing the beauty of the landscape, reflecting on all of the good that your donations will help bring about!
 
 Together, we can help better the well-being of our planet and the beautiful array of life that it supports!



With all donations With all donations $30 or more, you will receive a photo print of one of Earth's many little beauties and personalized message thanking you for your awesomeness.
With all donations of $50 or more, you will receive a nature-inspired drawing by yours truly.



 

 


Other Ways You Can Help


If you can't contribute, no worries!  That doesn't mean you can't help!

Get the word out about this campaign and make some noise in honor of this rad world we live in! 
Get out into nature and breathe deep - strengthen your appreciate for the world around you.  Take a friend!  Go on an epic adventure together!
"Liking" the Illinois Wildlife Medical Clinic and the American Forests on Facebook is a great way to see all of the strides being made towards a more animal-friendly world.

http://www.facebook.com/UIWMC
http://www.facebook.com/AmericanForests

story:
For English version please scroll down.

Was ist unsere Vision?

Die Energiewende zu 100% erneuerbare Energien so schnell wie möglich zu erreichen.

Was ist PV-Log?

PV-Log (www.pv-log.com) ist ein freies Internetportal, welches es Solarstromproduzenten (und solchen, die es werden wollen) möglich macht, PV-Anlagen zu überwachen, miteinander zu vergleichen und mit anderen Betreibern zu kommunizieren. Mit Hilfe eines direkten Vergleichs lässt sich auf einfache Weise der Ertrag der eigenen Photovoltaik-Anlage optimieren. PV-Log ist kompetent, modern und informativ.

PV-Log ist ein lebendiges, schnell wachsendes, internationales Projekt mit schon heute über 1.000 registrierten Anlagen. PV-Log ist das neueste Projekt von Top50-Solar.

Wozu eine PV-Log App?

PV-Log wird ständig nach den Wünschen der Nutzer weiterentwickelt. Eine App ist einer der beliebtesten Feature-Wünsche der PV-Log Nutzer. Die PV-Log App soll PV-Log mobil machen, so dass jeder, auch von unterwegs die Informationen optimiert für die Darstellung auf einem Smartphone abrufen kann. Die PV-Log App soll zuerst auf Basis von HTML5 programmiert werden, so dass sie sowohl auf iPhone/iPad wie auch auf Android-Geräten funktioniert.

Hier schon einmal eine Idee, wie eine solche App aussehen könnte:

Folgende Features sind für die erste Version der App geplant:

  • Anzeige der Erträge der eigenen Anlage
  • Anzeige von Anlagenprofilen
  • Anzeige der Solar-Friends Anlagen

Wofür benötigen wir Deine Unterstützung?

Das vom Crowdfunding erhaltene Geld werden wir für die Entwicklung der ersten Version der PV-Log App verwenden. Mit 3.000 Euro können wir eine erste Basisversion erstellen. Wir haben natürlich viele Ideen für Features. Je mehr Geld zusammen kommt und je deutlicher wir das Kampagnenziel übertreffen, desto umfangreicher können wir die App mit Funktionen ausstatten und die Website von PV-Log erweitern.

Aber selbst wenn Du uns nicht finanziell unterstützen kannst, dann hilfst Du uns sehr, wenn Du diese Kampagne bekannt machst: Poste darüber auf Facebook, Twitter, leite sie per Email weiter oder berichte in Deinem Blog.

Warum gerade Crowdfunding und gerade jetzt?

Durch die Teilnahme am Gründergarage Wettbewerb haben wir die Chance, dass Google Eure Unterstützung nochmals verdoppelt. Eine Voraussetzung ist: Wir erreichen das Crowdfundingziel von 3.000,- Euro, das sollte doch zu schaffen sein, oder? Außerdem hat das Projekt dadurch die Chance, noch mehr Aufmerksamkeit zu erhalten.

Was hab ich damit zu tun?

Falls Du bisher keine Photovoltaik Anlage betreibst, fragst Du Dich jetzt womöglich, was habe ich damit zu tun?

Man braucht keine eigene Anlage, um PV-Log zu nutzen. Dadurch ist es möglich, vorab Informationen zu möglichen Erträgen einer geplanten Anlage zu erhalten. Darüber hinaus ist es vor einem Anlagenkauf ratsam, bezüglich bestimmter Produkte oder anderen Fragestellungen zum Betrieb einer PV-Anlage, Erfahrung von anderen Anwendern einzuholen. PV-Log ist also auch für alle Nutzer interessant, die sich mit dem Gedanken tragen, irgendwann in Zukunft eine Solaranlage zu installieren. Zusätzlich trägt PV-Log dazu bei, die Fortschritte bei der Energiewende sichtbar zu machen.

Wer steckt dahinter?

Wir sind ein junges, innovatives Team und sind davon überzeugt, dass eine weite Verbreitung der erneuerbaren Energien und eine dezentrale Energieversorgung das A und O der Zukunft unserer Erde sind.

Martin ist der Gründer von Top50-Solar und PV-Log. Schon seit über 15 Jahren engagiert er sich für die Solarenergie. Seine Vision für PV-Log ist, die fortschrittlichen Akteure der Energiewende effizient miteinander zu vernetzen und tolle Features für PV-Anlagenbesitzer (und solche, die es werden wollen) weltweit anzubieten.
 
Ivonne hat Wirtschaftsinformatik an der BA in Stuttgart studiert. Sie beschäftigt sich hauptsächlich mit Support Fragen bei PV-Log und lernt immer mehr über den technischen Aspekt dieses umfangreichen Webportals. Die App erscheint ihr ein wichtiges Projekt für die Weiterentwicklung von PV-Log und die Verbreitung der Photovoltaik-Stromerzeugung weltweit.

Marc ist einer der Programmierer und Entwickler von PV-Log. Er hat einen Abschluss als Dipl.-Betriebswiert (FH). Seit der Anschaffung seiner ersten Photovoltaikanlage lässt ihn diese zukunftsweisende Technik nicht mehr los. Er möchte sie jedem Interessenten so transparent wie möglich machen und genau deswegen benötigen wir seiner Meinung nach die PV-Log App.

Desweiteren gehören zum Team Zoe, Thierry und Nicole, die uns z.B. helfen, PV-Log international zu verbreiten, das Projekt nutzerfreundlich und graphisch ansprechend zu gestalten.

Die Presse über PV-Log

Zeitschrift Sonnenenergie: Social Monitoring

Energynet: Soziales Netzwerk für Photovoltaik ermöglicht mehr Transparenz und bessere Vernetzung von Anlagenbetreibern

photovoltaik-Magazin: Web 2.0 für Ertragsdaten

Solarserver: Erstes soziales Netzwerk für Photovoltaik: Bei PV-Log können private Betreiber ihre Solarstrom-Anlagen kostenlos vergleichen

Solarthemen: PV-Log für unabhängigen Ertragsdaten-Vergleich

Der Top50-Solar Blog

 

 

 

English Version


Our vision

To achieve the energy transition towards 100% renewable energy as soon as possible.

What is PV-log?

PV Log (www.pv-log.com) is a free web portal allowing solar power operators (and those who aspire to be) to easily monitor photovoltaic systems, compare them to each other and to communicate with other solar installation operators. By directly comparing, it is easy to optimize the performance of your own photovoltaic system. PV-Log is effective, modern and informative.

PV-Log is a vibrant, fast-growing, international project with to date already over a 1000 registered installations. PV-Log is the latest project of Top50-Solar.

Why a PV-Log App?

PV-Log is continuously being further developed according to the wishes of the users. Currently an App is the most popular feature request from PV-Log users. The PV-Log App will make PV-Log mobile so that, even on the go, everyone can retrieve the information optimized for smartphone display. The first version of the PV-Log App will be programmed in HTML5, so it works on both iPhone / iPad and Android devices.

Here’s an idea of what the App might look like:


The following features have been planned for the first version of the App:

  • Display of yield data for your own installation
  • Display of installation profiles
  • Display of Solar-Friends installations

Why do we need your support?

We will use the funds generated by this crowdfunding campaign to develop the first version of the PV-Log App. A first basic version can be created for 3.000 euros. Of course we have many ideas for additional features. The more funds we raise, the more we exceed the campaign goal, the more we will be able to provide the App and the PV-Log website with extra features.

But even if you can not help us financially, you would help us out a lot by helping to promote this campaign: post about it on Facebook, Twitter, forward it by email and/or blog about it.

Why crowdfunding and why now?

By participating in the contest of Gruender-Garage, we have a chance that Google doubles your contributions. A prerequisite is that we reach the crowdfunding target of 3.000, - Euro. That should be achievable, right? In addition, the campaign will give PV-Log a lot of extra media exposure.

Why would I get involved?

If you do not yet operate a photovoltaic system, you might possibly wonder, why you should get involved?

First of all you do not need to own a solar installation to use PV-Log. The use of PV-Log enables you to get information on the potential production of a planned installation. Further, before buying a solar installation it is advisable to seek the experience of other users on specific products or on issues involved in operating a PV system. So PV-Log is interesting for anyone who is considering  installing a solar system at some point in the future. And last but not least, PV-Log supports the energy transition by making its progress visible. Be a part of the energy revolution by supporting the PV-Log project!

Who is behind it?

We are a young, innovative team and we are convinced that a wide adoption of renewable and decentralized energy production is essential for the future of our planet.

Martin is the founder of Top50-Solar and PV-Log. For over 15 years he has been active in the field of solar energy. His vision for PV-Log is to efficiently connect all those involved in the energy transition stage with each other and to provide PV system owners worldwide (and those who aspire to be) with great features.

Ivonne studied business and computer science at the vocational Academy in Stuttgart, Germany. She deals mainly with support questions at PV-Log and continuously learns more about the technical aspects of this extensive web portal. She sees the App as a significant step in the development of PV-Log and the dissemination of photovoltaic power generation worldwide.

Marc is one of the programmers and developers of PV-Log. He has a graduate degree in economics. Ever since acquiring his first photovoltaic system, he has been fascinated by this pioneering technology. He would like to make it as transparent as possible for anyone interested, and that's why, in his opinion, we need the PV-Log App.

The rest of the team is made up of Zoe, Thierry and Nicole, who help us spread PV-Log internationally, assist in making the project more user-friendly and graphically appealing.

PV-Log in the press

Zeitschrift Sonnenenergie: Social Monitoring

Energynet: Soziales Netzwerk für Photovoltaik ermöglicht mehr Transparenz und bessere Vernetzung von Anlagenbetreibern

photovoltaik-Magazin: Web 2.0 für Ertragsdaten

Solarserver: Erstes soziales Netzwerk für Photovoltaik: Bei PV-Log können private Betreiber ihre Solarstrom-Anlagen kostenlos vergleichen

Solarthemen: PV-Log für unabhängigen Ertragsdaten-Vergleich

Top50-Solar Blog


PERKS

€ 5 Thank you Facebook / Twitter / Email
We will send you a thank note through our Facebook page, our Twitter account and by email, each with a link to your website, Facebook page or Twitter account.

€ 10 PV-Log Helper
You get an entry in the list of supporters on the PV-Log website.

€ 50 PV-Log Supporter
You get all of  the above and the Supporter status for 1 year. As a PV-Log Supporter you receive the following benefits: Free App use, access to beta versions of the App (i.e. you will get to use the App about 3 months before others),  access to additional features of the PV-Log portal which we will be developing and releasing during the upcoming year. Be surprised :-).

€ 100 PV-Log Bronze Sponsor
The PV-Log Helper and Supporter perks + your name mentioned with a link to your website on the sponsor page of the App.

€ 1,000 PV-Log Silver Sponsor
The PV-Log Bronze Sponsor perks + an exclusive blog post and press release about your support.

€ 2,500 Special Ad Package I
Special Ad package to promote your company or product. Get in contact with us for details.

€ 5,000 PV-Log Gold Sponsor
PV-Log Silver Sponsor perks + placement of your logo in our partner area (footer) of the website and link to your website for 1 year.

story:
Helping Rare Hawaiian False Killer Whales -- The Big Idea

Join us in making a real difference!  We are a group of middle school students and educators who work throughout the school year on environmental stewardship projects.  We partner with scientists in our community and beyond, and we make a change in our world.  One of our projects is to raise public awareness of a little known species whose future is tipping in the balance. 

The rare Hawaiian False Killer Whale population is in steep decline, but if we do something now, we can make a real, immediate difference.  Help save a unique ocean creature who:

  • actually circles up and passes a fish around for each pod member to take a bite
  • routinely tosses fish ONTO fishing boats in a generous habit of sharing
  • lives only in the waters around the Hawaiian Islands, unlike their pelagic cousins
  • is perilously close to extinction

What We Need & What You Get

Your donations and attention will support the following:

  • Junior Ocean Scientists (a group of middle school students in Hawaii) spread the word to all ages and initiate prompt action
  • funding goes to sending two Junior Ocean Scientist representatives and their teacher to the State Capital to meet with elected officials in designating the Hawaiian False Killer Whale as Hawaii's state whale
  • additional funding also supports community events (such as Science Cafes, presentations, and middle school dances) that inform people about this unique species and gather support for legal protection
  • our work builds community and fosters a positive, can-do attitude towards making a difference in our world

We offer our generous supporters the option of being listed and highlighted on our website, http://huimalama.weebly.com/.  Become part of our circle of energetic, enthusiastic, all-walks-of-life, networking, whale huggers!!

The Impact

Raising awareness of Hawaiian False Killer Whales and their situation will:

  • activate the switch from old-style fish hooks to circle hooks faster
  • jump start the process of designating the Hawaiian False Killer Whale as Hawaii's state whale
  • directly connect students with elected officials (hard to say no to our passionate youth!)
  • push measureable, effective measures through the legal process faster
  • activate more people in protecting our environment
  • educate our youth in environmental stewardship, community activism, and personal responsibility

Our students have already:

  • organized and run Science Cafes for the community
  • designed and run False Killer Whale dances at our school
  • worked hard at grass-roots fundraising in our economically challenged rural community -- countless bake sales, car washes, school stores, etc.  They put in the hours and the heart to make a change for our ocean friends!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you find you aren't able to make a monetary contribution, please consider:

  • get the word out about the Hawaiian False Killer Whale through your favorite social media;  feel free to send your friends to our website, http://huimalama.weebly.com/
  • signing our petition for designating the Hawaiian False Killer Whale as Hawaii's state whale
  • contact us through our website with your own idea of ways you can help :)
  • use the Indiegogo share tools!

Junior Ocean Scientists (a group of middle school students in Hawaii) spread the word to all ages and initiate prompt action
funding goes to sending two Junior Ocean Scientist representatives and their teacher to the State Capital to meet with elected officials in designating the Hawaiian False Killer Whale as Hawaii's state whale
additional funding also supports community events (such as Science Cafes, presentations, and middle school dances) that inform people about this unique species and gather support for legal protection
our work builds community and fosters a positive, can-do attitude towards making a difference in our world
We offer our generous supporters the option of being listed and highlighted on our website, http://huimalama.weebly.com/.  Become part of our circle of energetic, enthusiastic, all-walks-of-life, networking, whale huggers!!
The Impact
Raising awareness of Hawaiian False Killer Whales and their situation will:

activate the switch from old-style fish hooks to circle hooks faster
jump start the process of designating the Hawaiian False Killer Whale as Hawaii's state whale
directly connect students with elected officials (hard to say no to our passionate youth!)
push measureable, effective measures through the legal process faster
activate more people in protecting our environment
educate our youth in environmental stewardship, community activism, and personal responsibility
Our students have already:

organized and run Science Cafes for the community
designed and run False Killer Whale dances at our school
worked hard at grass-roots fundraising in our economically challenged rural community -- countless bake sales, car washes, school stores, etc.  They put in the hours and the heart to make a change for our ocean friends!

Other Ways You Can Help
If you find you aren't able to make a monetary contribution, please consider:

get the word out about the Hawaiian False Killer Whale through your favorite social media;  feel free to send your friends to our website, http://huimalama.weebly.com/

signing our petition for designating the Hawaiian False Killer Whale as Hawaii's state whale
contact us through our website with your own idea of ways you can help :)
use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
A little over a month ago, I entered a competition to join a research expedition through the North Atlantic, unfortunately I was unsuccessful. When I posted on Facebook to inform my friends that I hadn't won a spot on the expedition, some of them convinced me (although it didn't take too much) to have another crack at joining. This time by buying a place on the vessel. In order to do this, I need to get myself to Bermuda and pay $8,500 within 15 days to gain a position on the vessel.

Preserving the beauty of this planet for future generations is my passion. Gaining a position on this expedition would give me priceless experience and knowledge to combat marine debris.


 On June 7th, 2014 The 5 Gyres Institute will be setting sail from Bermuda charting a course for the heart of The North Atlantic Gyre aboard the mighty Sea Dragon, ending three weeks later in Iceland. There are a total of 7 berths available for the public to join the crew at a cost of $8,500.

In addition to research, each crewmember will also participate in a nightly educational program in the areas of science, community engagement, and policy. 5 Gyres has completed 12 expeditions.

story:
My Story

Hello! Thank you for visiting my campaign! My name is Lydia and I have been a dedicated student of Joanna Macy's for the past 4 years, learning practices in ecological education, community building, and group process work.  I was first introduced to Joanna while pursuing a Masters in Philosophy and Religion at the California Institute of Integral Studies. I have been deeply influenced by Joanna's work, which has helped many people learn to hold the difficult feelings that can arise from being present with the realities of our current environmental crises. This work has the ability to help us speak our truth, deepen our communities, and catalyze our willingness to show up for each other and our world.  I am also passionate about food justice and sustainable food cultivation, including permaculture practices.

The Project

I have facilitated the Work That Reconnects all over the US, and now have the incredible opportunity to go to Indonesia from February 14-28 of this year.  I will be visiting two trully amazing friends of Joanna's who have been engaged in sustainability work through the ClimateWorks Foundation as well as community building through the Samdhana Institute. Both of my hosts are also facilitators of the Work That Reconnects, and while I am there I will be engaged in training and strategy session, joining them to learn from their good works and offer my own training and gifts.  Through this kind of firsthand experience I will be able to extend my knowledge and experience of effective hands-on sustainability work. It would mean so much to me to be able to do this, and with your help it will happen!

What I Need & What You Get

In order to make this happen I will need:

$1200-1400 for a plane ticket

$800 travel expenses including transportation, food, and lodging

$300 project documentation/materials fund

As a token of my gratitude, I would like to offer a variety of gifts as a thank you for your contribution. Thank you so much for making this opportunity a reality!

story:
Look how close we are! As of 8:37 pm, we need $450 to meet our goal. And just as an additional incentive, the person who makes the donation that takes us over $15,000 will receive a matted nature photograph of the Gateway Nature Center site, signed by Avery Locklear! Whether you donate $1 or $100, If you push us to $15,000, it's yours!

What a wild ride it's been! I am so grateful for all the people who have come together to support our cause. Thank you, thank you, thank you!

“How many great conservation victories have been achieved without the hard work of ordinary folks who didn't want to see a place they loved destroyed? I can't think of a single one. The strongest passion for protection springs from love.”

                                                    —Michael Brune, Sierra Club Executive Director

For me, the Gateway Nature Center has been a labor of love, but I have had a lot of support along the way. To date we have had 65 donations to the Indiegogo campaign alone—including from many people who are new to our project! Add that to the many  who have given in the past, and I have much to be grateful for.

Our Indiegogo campaign ends on Monday. Please consider a donation to help us reach our goal, and spread the word about it to everyone you know who might be interested!


Saving the World . . . 19 Acres at a Time

The Gateway Environmental Initiative is working to create something new—an urban nature center less than a mile south of downtown Winston-Salem, North Carolina. The 19-acre site we are working to buy was threatened with development a few years ago. Since then, we have brought together neighbors, environmentalists, families, educators, city officials, and the landowner to work toward our goal—creating a vibrant nature center that brings children and nature together.

Our site straddles Salem Creek. To the south is a wide-open floodplain where power lines coexist with bird and butterfly habitat. To the north is dense woods populated by hawks, owls, and migratory birds, as well as the occasional deer and red fox. Nature’s power to survive in an urban setting is amazing!

Why Now? Why in the City?

In his book Last Child in the Woods, Richard Louv eloquently describes what he calls “nature-deficit disorder.” When children’s lives are filled with structured and technology-driven activities at the expense of exploring nature and open-ended creative play, cognitive and emotional development can suffer. A nature preserve and natural playscape in the city will allow children of all backgrounds to connect with a natural environment.

The nature center we plan is unique to Winston-Salem; it will be a place where children, families, and the general public will engage with nature in an intimate way. A place where school groups will go outside to learn about nature, not from books, but from hands-on interaction with the natural world. A place where every activity, from bioremediation of toxic soils to planting bird and butterfly habitats, is a learning experience.

While we have to stay focused on fundraising right now, we also are creating a plan for what we would like to see in a few years. This plan shows areas for trails, natural playscapes, wetlands, bird and butterfly habitats, bioremediation, ADA-accessible garden areas, viewing pavilions, and more!

                  

Our Funding Successes

Thanks to foundations, the city of Winston-Salem, and private donors who believe in the value of the Gateway Nature Center, we have raised $300,000 of the $409,000 purchase price.  A big shout-out to the supporters who have helped us get this far:

  •       $50,000     Winston-Salem Foundation        
  •       $50,000     John W. and Anna H. Hanes Foundation
  •       $25,000     Duke Energy Foundation           
  •       $11,000     Private donations
  •     $164,000    City of WS's loan forgiveness to the seller  

To close on the property, we need to raise another $50,000.

Our goal is to raise $15,000 through this Indiegogo campaign. We are also seeking additional foundation support and private donations. We will keep you posted on our progress!

Local/Sustainable Perks for You!

In line with our nature focus, a lot of our perks take you out in nature or have a sustainable vibe. We're very excited about the local companies that are cutting costs for some perks, including Triad ECO Adventures, Beta Verde, Avery Locklear Photography, and TS Designs.

Other perks offer you the opportunity to have a lasting impact on the Gateway Nature Center—by helping choose the design of a park bench dedicated to you or someone you want to honor; or participating in the design of an information kiosk that will not only share programming and seasonal information, but reflect an aesthetic vision that is reflected in the nature center as a whole.  

ALL the  funds raised, once we have covered costs of the perks, will go toward the purchase of the site. A big shout-out to the Sierra Club Foothills Group for a donation for operating expenses, which allows us to apply every cent raised toward this goal.

Create Your Own Perk
Do you want to connect with the Gateway Nature Center in another way? Let us know and we can work something out!

How to Get Your Perk
To save postage and time, we are offering the option of picking up your perk at the PEA Piedmont Earth Day Fair on Saturday, April 26. This will give us a chance to thank you in person, too! Of course, if that's not convenient, we will mail or deliver at a time that works for you.

The Impact

As the environmental issues we face become more and more complex, people around the world are working to address the challenges in their own communities. The GEI is one of thousands of groups committed to make a difference by conserving land, and changing how we think about the value of green space, and promoting positive interaction with the environment in our own backyards.

When the GEI formed in 2008, people told us to forget about conserving this land, it was going to be developed! We couldn't live with that. We kept talking to city officials, neighbors, and potential funders. Thanks to our persistence, the city, the developer, neighborhoods, and foundations are supporting our vision of a environmental resource that both supports ecosystem resilence and connects people with nature.

When you support our campaign, you are contributing to something lasting—a protected nature preserve that will be a resource for generations to come. When you  stroll along new trails, discover a flower or bird you never saw before, or share the site with friends and family, you'll know you played a part in making this happen.

We're Having Fun! Join Us!

The word is spreading about the Gateway Nature Center. We hope you'll find a perk appealing, and even more we hope you'll get involved in our programs and planning for the future.

  • Please help us get the word out to people who might want to support us!
  • The Indiegogo share tools make spreading the word easy! Post on Facebook, tweet, and help us make the Gateway Nature Center a reality!
